Review_Description: Delicately fruity, richly floral-toned. Froot Loops cereal, crimson lily, cocoa nib, tangerine zest, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Delicate juicy acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Lily and cocoa nib support a crisply fruity finish.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately fruity, richly floral-toned. Froot Loops cereal, crimson lily, cocoa nib, tangerine zest, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Delicate juicy acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Lily and cocoa nib support a crisply fruity finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, with the fermentation of the whole fruit preceded by sterilization with ozone gas and ultraviolet light and with yeasts added to the fermentation. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Bottom_Line: A complex, deep-toned, very fruit-forward anaerobic natural Colombia Sidra redolent of Froot Loops cereal with a side of hot cocoa.

Review_Description: Sweetly chocolaty and nut-toned. Baking chocolate, almond brittle, gardenia, cherry soda, cedar in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, almondy finish.

Coffee_Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Natural
Review_Description: Richly fruity, deeply chocolaty. Dark chocolate, dried peach, honeysuckle, maple syrup, marjoram in aroma and cup. Richly sweet structure with fruit-toned acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish centers around notes of dark chocolate and honeysuckle.

Coffee_Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Geisha Washed
Review_Description: High-toned, juicy-sweet. Lemongrass, cocoa nib, magnolia, amber, bergamot in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy, sparkling acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with notes of lemongrass and cocoa nib, supported by sweet magnolia.
Blind_Assessment: High-toned, juicy-sweet. Lemongrass, cocoa nib, magnolia, amber, bergamot in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy, sparkling acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with notes of lemongrass and cocoa nib, supported by sweet magnolia.

Bottom_Line: Elegantly spice-toned, richly floral, complex — a classic washed Panama Geisha cup.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine, wild honey, tarragon, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Sweet, gently tart acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Integrated, long, flavor-saturated finish.
Origin: Ka'u growing district, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind_Assessment: Delicately fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine, wild honey, tarragon, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Sweet, gently tart acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Integrated, long, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: This 100% Ka’u coffee was developed by Lorie Obra of Rusty’s, one of Ka’u’s best-known and most celebrated farms. Produced from trees of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Visit www.rustyshawaiian.com or call 808-928-8916 for more information.
Bottom_Line: This decadently sweet, elegantly tart, complex natural-processed Hawai’i Ka’u is an exercise in balance and a nuanced flavor journey.

Review_Description: Richly earthy, deeply spice-toned. Graphite, pink peppercorn, guava, fresh-cut cedar, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-savory with gently bright acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. Pleasing savory-leaning finish centered around graphite and pink peppercorn with undertones of sweet-tart guava.
Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Blind_Assessment: Richly earthy, deeply spice-toned. Graphite, pink peppercorn, guava, fresh-cut cedar, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-savory with gently bright acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. Pleasing savory-leaning finish centered around graphite and pink peppercorn with undertones of sweet-tart guava.
Notes: Produced by 200 widows with support and training from husband-wife team Kardon and Yulinda, from trees of the Andungsari, LiniS795 and Sigararutang varieties of Arabica. Coffees like this one from the northern part of the Indonesian island of Sumatra are valued for their complex earth and fruit notes that appear to result largely from unorthodox fruit removal and drying practices called “wet-hulling.” Speckled Ax is a roaster based in Portland, Maine, specializing in high-quality certified organic and small-lot coffees. The company roasts in a vintage wood-fired Petroncini roaster with the goal of highlighting each coffee’s best attributes. Visit www.speckledax.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A classic Sumatra cup that highlights the origin’s potential for depth and complexity, with a distinct throughline that evokes fresh earth just after a rain.

Coffee_Name: Panama Finca Don Julian Geisha Washed
Review_Description: Brightly sweet, floral-toned. Narcissus, pink grapefruit, apricot, almond butter, bay leaf in aroma and cup. High-toned acidity; very smooth, silky mouthfeel. The resonant finish amplifies narcissus and almond.

Review_Description: Richly chocolaty, boldly structured. Dark chocolate, pomegranate, fresh-cut oak, agave syrup, oregano in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart with a dry, tannic structure and gently bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The harmonious finish consolidates to dark chocolate and oregano.

Bottom_Line: This chocolate-forward Guatemala cup has a tart fruit backbone with complications from enticing sweet-savory herb notes.

Coffee_Name: Taiwan Nantou Yuchi Kanon Estate SL34 Natural
Review_Description: Richly sweet-savory. Salted caramel, tamarind, hazelnut, freesia, green peppercorn in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The lingering finish leads with salted caramel and tamarind.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Salted caramel, tamarind, hazelnut, freesia, green peppercorn in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The lingering finish leads with salted caramel and tamarind.

Bottom_Line: An umami undercurrent complicates this otherwise juicy-sweet SL34 produced in Taiwan.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Yirgacheffe Burtukan Wako Natural G1
Review_Description: Richly sweet, crisply floral. Magnolia, cashew, maple syrup, dried nectarine, myrrh in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. The crisp finish highlights notes of almond and myrrh.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet, crisply floral. Magnolia, cashew, maple syrup, dried nectarine, myrrh in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. The crisp finish highlights notes of almond and myrrh.

Review_Description: Berry-driven, spice-toned. Mulberry, clove, ginger blossom, oak, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweetly brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The spice-toned finish leads with notes of ginger blossom and clove.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, crisply chocolaty. Dark chocolate, dried cherry, cashew, gently scorched cedar, gardenia in aroma and cup. Richly sweet with mild acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Very chocolaty finish with undertones of dried cherry and gardenia.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, sweetly citrusy. Pomelo, cantaloupe, cocoa nib, lemon-thyme, caramel in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to pretty notes of lemon-thyme and cantaloupe.
Blind_Assessment: Deep-toned, sweetly citrusy. Pomelo, cantaloupe, cocoa nib, lemon-thyme, caramel in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to pretty notes of lemon-thyme and cantaloupe.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed at Tiluse Washing Station by the honey method (some fruit flesh is left on the beans during the drying process). Review_Description: Round, cocoa-toned, richly bittersweet. Cocoa nib, date, maple syrup, walnut, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Softly brisk structure; lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates around walnut and maple syrup in a crisp finish.
Blind_Assessment: Round, cocoa-toned, richly bittersweet. Cocoa nib, date, maple syrup, walnut, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Softly brisk structure; lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates around walnut and maple syrup in a crisp finish.

Review_Description: Juicy, fruit-driven. Dried apricot, rambutan, cocoa nib, magnolia, bergamot in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, vibrant acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Floral finish with dried apricot undertones.
Blind_Assessment: Juicy, fruit-driven. Dried apricot, rambutan, cocoa nib, magnolia, bergamot in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, vibrant acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Floral finish with dried apricot undertones.
Notes: Produced by Jorge Rojas of Finca La Roca, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey anaerobic method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans both while they undergo fermentation in a hermetically sealed vessel, and when they are dried. Review_Description: Tangy-sweet, richly aromatic. Tamarind, salted caramel, cedar, magnolia, lemon yogurt in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; very full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Tart-leaning finish with ballast from caramel notes.
Blind_Assessment: Tangy-sweet, richly aromatic. Tamarind, salted caramel, cedar, magnolia, lemon yogurt in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet-tart acidity; very full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Tart-leaning finish with ballast from caramel notes.
Notes: Produced by Edward Giraldo of Finca La Esperanza, entirely of the Typica variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. Review_Description: Deeply aromatic, rich-toned. Bergamot, nectarine, cocoa nib, hazelnut butter, wisteria in aroma and cup. Sweetly spice-toned with juicy, integrated acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Balanced, long, very bright finish.

Review_Description: Richly cocoa-toned, citrusy. Tangerine, dark chocolate, pecan, marjoram, narcissus in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; crisp, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of tangerine and pecan.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-forward. Dried strawberry, cherry blossom, honey, sandalwood, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with balanced, fruit-toned acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisply berry-driven finish.

Review_Description: Very sweet, fruit-driven. Honeydew melon, Froot Loops cereal, cocoa nib, orange zest, oak in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The finish is long, sweet, and fruit-toned.

Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from selections of traditional varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) with the addition of wine yeasts in the drying process. Bottom_Line: An exceptionally sweet, melony and cocoa-toned Ethiopia, a natural-processed coffee with yeast added during a 4-day ferment phase before final drying.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, earthy-sweet. Dark chocolate, petrichor, freesia, tangerine zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Savory-leaning structure with brisk acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of sweet earthiness.

Review_Description: Richly fruit-toned, juicy-sweet. Dried cherry, almond butter, cocoa nib, narcissus, oak in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet-tart acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Dried cherry and almond butter lead in the resonant finish.
Blind_Assessment: Richly fruit-toned, juicy-sweet. Dried cherry, almond butter, cocoa nib, narcissus, oak in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet-tart acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Dried cherry and almond butter lead in the resonant finish.

Review_Description: Complex, richly fruit-toned. Lychee, dark chocolate, sandalwood, honey, wisteria in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet with juicy, balanced acidity; full, very silky mouthfeel. Long, lingering finish resonant with honey and wisteria.

Notes: Produced at Lucy Station in the Bench-Maji Zone of southern Ethiopia, entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Review_Description: Crisply fruit-forward, gently spice-toned. Raspberry, nutmeg, walnut, amber, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with gently round acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and nutmeg.

Notes: This version of the ancient Mocha-Java blend persuasively combines a traditionally processed, wet-hulled Sumatra Ketiara in place of the original Java and replaces the Yemen Mocha with Ethiopia Guji Uraga natural (40:60 post-roast blend). Pegasus Coffee is a Bainbridge Island, Washington roastery with a cafe on the island and another in nearby downtown Seattle. Visit www.pegasuscoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: An engaging variation on the classic theme of Mocha Java — crisp, fruity, chocolaty, and complicated by warming spice notes.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Huila El Vergel Yellow Fruit Anaerobic
Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory, gently lactic. Pineapple yogurt, lemon balm, baking chocolate, sandalwood, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with tangy acidity; soft, satiny mouthfeel. Fruit- and cocoa-toned finish.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory, gently lactic. Pineapple yogurt, lemon balm, baking chocolate, sandalwood, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with tangy acidity; soft, satiny mouthfeel. Fruit- and cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Marta Bayter and her sons, Shady and Elias, of Vergel Estate, from trees of the Yellow Caturra and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the coffee is fermented in the whole fruit with limited access to oxygen before drying. Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit shopee.tw/zengkaochen for more information.
Bottom_Line: A lactic-fruity, crisply chocolaty anaerobic natural with balance and finesse.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet, gently floral. Apricot, magnolia, baking chocolate, lemon zest, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; lightly silky mouthfeel. The wood-framed finish is supported by notes of lemon zest and magnolia.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet, gently floral. Apricot, magnolia, baking chocolate, lemon zest, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; lightly silky mouthfeel. The wood-framed finish is supported by notes of lemon zest and magnolia.
Notes: Produced at Zuoyuan Farm in Yunnan, China, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Gee Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster with 12 cafes in Guangzhou and Shenzhen, China. Visit the brand’s wechat official account, Gee Coffee Roasters, for more information.
Bottom_Line: A friendly, accessible washed Geisha grown in China’s Yunnan Province — crisply chocolaty and floral with aromatic wood undertones.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca El Paraíso Geisha Sake
Review_Description: Exuberantly aromatic, rich, very complex. Bergamot, Concord grape, ginger blossom, pistachio, lychee in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright, exceptionally high-toned acidity; lush, silky mouthfeel. Rich, pungent, crisply sweet finish.
Blind_Assessment: Exuberantly aromatic, rich, very complex. Bergamot, Concord grape, ginger blossom, pistachio, lychee in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright, exceptionally high-toned acidity; lush, silky mouthfeel. Rich, pungent, crisply sweet finish.
Notes: Produced by Diego Bermudez, from trees of the original Panama T.2722 cultivar of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic washed method, in which the coffee fruit, after having been first sanitized with ozone, undergoes two stages of fermentation. First, the whole cherries are submerged under water for 48 hours, then the beans are pulped and fermented with a strain of Lactobacillus for 24 hours. After fermentation, the beans are given a “thermal shock” using hot and cold rinses to help the beans absorb the fermentation metabolites and halt any further fermentation. Afterward, the washed parchment coffee is rapidly dried with an in-house designed Eco-Enigma dehumidifying dryer to avoid over oxidation or continued fermentation. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A decadent, expressive, voluptuous double-anaerobic Colombia Geisha with a wide range of aromas and flavors, from spice-toned bergamot to super-sweet lychee.

Review_Description: Brightly sweet-tart, vibrant. Berry melange, cocoa nib, star jasmine, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; crisp, very syrupy mouthfeel. The sweet-toned finish centers around notes of raspberry and cocoa nib with undertones of star jasmine.
Blind_Assessment: Brightly sweet-tart, vibrant. Berry melange, cocoa nib, star jasmine, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Juicy, high-toned acidity; crisp, very syrupy mouthfeel. The sweet-toned finish centers around notes of raspberry and cocoa nib with undertones of star jasmine.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from traditional local varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A richly sweet-tart, energetic Tanzania with spicy floral and crisp cocoa nib notes — lively and enticing.

Review_Description: Sweetly tart, richly savory. Magnolia, pink grapefruit zest, ripe blackberry, dark chocolate, toffee in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet, complex structure with high-toned acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. Magnolia and blackberry notes lead in the long, resonant finish.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly tart, richly savory. Magnolia, pink grapefruit zest, ripe blackberry, dark chocolate, toffee in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet, complex structure with high-toned acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. Magnolia and blackberry notes lead in the long, resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gachatha Farmers’ Cooperative Society from trees of the SL28, SL34 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A particularly enticing rendition of the classic Kenya cup with deep, dark berry fruit and distinct undertones of dark chocolate and toffee.

Review_Description: Gently fruit-forward, balanced. Black cherry, tea rose, walnut, baking chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Bold, brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of black cherry and cedar.
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Blind_Assessment: Gently fruit-forward, balanced. Black cherry, tea rose, walnut, baking chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Bold, brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of black cherry and cedar.
Notes: Produced by Francisca and Oscar Chacon of Finca Las Lajas, from trees of the Caturra and Catuai varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters is an independent and family-owned and -operated cafe and coffee roaster specializing in socially and environmentally sustainable coffees. Visit www.consciouscup.com or call 815-356-0115 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A high-toned, fruity and floral-toned natural-processed Costa Rica.

Coffee_Name: Kenya Nyeri Gatuya Factory AA Top
Review_Description: Richly sweet-savory, juicy-bright. Dark chocolate, hop flowers, apricot, tangerine zest, cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned, lively acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish sustains its flavor-saturated structure far into the long.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, juicy-bright. Dark chocolate, hop flowers, apricot, tangerine zest, cedar in aroma and cup. High-toned, lively acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish sustains its flavor-saturated structure far into the long.
Notes: Produced at the Gatuya factory, from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A juicy, deep-toned Kenya cup with especially vibrant acidity and complex aromatics.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Tarrazu Double Anaerobic Washed
Review_Description: Richly sweet-tart, complex. Pineapple kefir, lilac, dark chocolate, amber, honey in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; satiny, viscous mouthfeel. A long finish centers around pineapple, amber and honey notes.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, complex. Pineapple kefir, lilac, dark chocolate, amber, honey in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; satiny, viscous mouthfeel. A long finish centers around pineapple, amber and honey notes.
Notes: Produced at Finca La Loma, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic washed method, in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered, deep-toned anaerobic natural Costa Rica with especially lively acidity.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Natural Bench Maji Lucy Station Gesha
Review_Description: Richly aromatic, fruit-forward. Mulberry, almond nougat, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisp, fruity, cocoa-toned finish.
Blind_Assessment: Richly aromatic, fruit-forward. Mulberry, almond nougat, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisp, fruity, cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A confident, fruit-driven, cocoa-toned natural Ethiopia Gesha cup with especially bright acidity.

Review_Description: Sweetly spice-toned. Nutmeg, baking chocolate, cranberry, oak, rhododendron in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Notes of baking chocolate, cranberry and oak lead in a resonant finish.
Origin: Pegasing, Takengon, Aceh Province, Sumatra, Indonesia
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned. Nutmeg, baking chocolate, cranberry, oak, rhododendron in aroma and cup. Pert acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Notes of baking chocolate, cranberry and oak lead in a resonant finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Gayo 1, Gayo 2, Catimor and Abyssinia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters is an independent and family-owned and -operated cafe and coffee roaster specializing in socially and environmentally sustainable coffees. Visit www.consciouscup.com or call 815-356-0115 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A natural-processed Sumatra animated by tart fruit and crisp chocolate suggestions.

Review_Description: Crisply cocoa-toned, quietly fruit-forward. Cocoa powder, mulberry, caramel, fir, orange zest in aroma and cup. Gentle acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish with notes of caramel and fir.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply cocoa-toned, quietly fruit-forward. Cocoa powder, mulberry, caramel, fir, orange zest in aroma and cup. Gentle acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish with notes of caramel and fir.
Notes: Produced by Mirna Lizeth Dominguez Marquez of Finca El Colobri, from trees of the Lempira and Parainema varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Conscious Cup Coffee Roasters is an independent and family-owned and -operated cafe and coffee roaster specializing in socially and environmentally sustainable coffees. Visit www.consciouscup.com or call 815-356-0115 for more information.
Bottom_Line: Sweet-toned and inviting throughout the profile, with leading notes of cocoa powder and caramel and berry and citrus undertones.

Review_Description: Understated, crisply sweet. Walnut, cocoa powder, maple syrup, pear, wine barrel in aroma and cup. Softly brisk acidity; lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates around maple syrup and walnut notes in the gently drying finish.
Blind_Assessment: Understated, crisply sweet. Walnut, cocoa powder, maple syrup, pear, wine barrel in aroma and cup. Softly brisk acidity; lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates around maple syrup and walnut notes in the gently drying finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Duwancho Cooperative, from trees of the 74158 Ethiopia variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A crisply sweet-savory, gently cocoa-toned Ethiopia natural with a pleasant hint of sweet ferment.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet, balanced. Baking chocolate, plum, magnolia, cedar, almond in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. The gently drying finish consolidates to almond and cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet, balanced. Baking chocolate, plum, magnolia, cedar, almond in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; velvety-smooth mouthfeel. The gently drying finish consolidates to almond and cedar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Ethiopia 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Lee Dong Coffee is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taichung, Taiwan. Visit www.facebook.com/LiDongcoffee/ for more information.
Bottom_Line: A balanced washed-process Ethiopia cup with pleasing notes of stone fruit and baking chocolate throughout the profile.

Review_Description: Quietly sweet-tart. Pomegranate, fir, caramel, freesia, almond in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Sweetly wood-framed finish supported by suggestions of freesia.
Origin: Arbegona Woreda, Bursa Kebele, Sidama Region, Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Quietly sweet-tart. Pomegranate, fir, caramel, freesia, almond in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Sweetly wood-framed finish supported by suggestions of freesia.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the 74158 Ethiopia variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A delicate, balanced washed Ethiopia cup, wood-framed with sweet floral undertones.

Coffee_Name: Brasil Ipanema Premier Cru BLUE A50 Red Anaerobic Natural
Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory. Date, ginkgo, vanilla yogurt, fir, saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Gently drying, tart finish.
Origin: Serra da Mantiqueira-Fazenda Rio Verde, Sul De Minas, Brazil
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory. Date, ginkgo, vanilla yogurt, fir, saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Gently drying, tart finish.
Notes: Produced by Ipanema Coffees at Fazenda Rio Verde, entirely of the Red Acaia variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the coffee is fermented in the whole fruit with limited access to oxygen before drying. Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A tart-leaning anaerobic natural Brazil cup with notes of sweet fruit, a lactic tang, and savory underpinnings.

Review_Description: Wildly expressive, richly compelling. Blackberry jam, sweet cream, frankincense, honeysuckle, dried pineapple in aroma and cup. Wine-like, very juicy, integrated acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Very long, very complex finish that leads with notes of wild blackberry and frankincense.
Blind_Assessment: Wildly expressive, richly compelling. Blackberry jam, sweet cream, frankincense, honeysuckle, dried pineapple in aroma and cup. Wine-like, very juicy, integrated acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Very long, very complex finish that leads with notes of wild blackberry and frankincense.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of La Macarena Farm, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of yeast stains), which includes sterilizing the cherries with ozone gas and ultraviolet light. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information.
Bottom_Line: An elegant, decadent, pied piper of a coffee with its mesmerizing aromatics and addictively complex cup with notes like blackberry jam and frankincense — you’ll find more descriptors than you can count on both hands.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas SL28 Natural
Review_Description: Floral-toned, rich with fruit. Star jasmine, passionfruit, cocoa nib, wild honey, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet acidity; very syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, integrated finish.
Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Blind_Assessment: Floral-toned, rich with fruit. Star jasmine, passionfruit, cocoa nib, wild honey, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet acidity; very syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, integrated finish.
Notes: Produced by Francisca and Oscar Chacon of Finca Las Lajas entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Magnolia Coffee is a Charlotte-based specialty roaster whose mission is to use sustainably sourced coffees to make a difference in the lives of coffee workers and to foster a socially conscious community with cause-supporting coffees. Visit www.magnoliacoffeeco.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A juicy, vibrantly balanced, deeply fruit- and floral-toned natural Costa Rica, powerfully aromatic.

Review_Description: Delicate, complex, high-toned. Bergamot, plumeria, lemongrass, cocoa nib, dried apricot in aroma and cup. Juicy, balanced acidity; exceptionally silky mouthfeel. The finish fulfills the promise of the cup, carrying forward all of the flavor and aroma notes.
Origin: Agaro Gera, Jimma Zone, Oromia State, Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Delicate, complex, high-toned. Bergamot, plumeria, lemongrass, cocoa nib, dried apricot in aroma and cup. Juicy, balanced acidity; exceptionally silky mouthfeel. The finish fulfills the promise of the cup, carrying forward all of the flavor and aroma notes.
Notes: Produced by the Nano Genji cooperative in Ethiopia’s Jimma Zone. Ethiopia coffees like this one are produced largely from selections of local, indigenous varieties of Arabica. Processed by the wet or washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Certified organic. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A lovely expression of the classic washed Ethiopia profile: juicy, bright, multi-layered, tropical.

Review_Description: Raspberry jam, toffee, dark chocolate, lilac, hint of teriyaki sauce in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Savory-leaning in the resonant finish with notes of teriyaki sauce supported by dark chocolate.
Blind_Assessment: Raspberry jam, toffee, dark chocolate, lilac, hint of teriyaki sauce in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Savory-leaning in the resonant finish with notes of teriyaki sauce supported by dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Finca El Paraíso entirely of the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of brewer’s yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Green Stone Coffee is a woman-owned artisan roastery in Taipei, Taiwan founded in 2016 and specializing in sourcing distinctive coffees that express their individual terroirs. Visit www.greenstone-coffee.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A richly sweet experimentally processed Colombia cup with floral and umami undercurrents throughout (think lilac and teriyaki in strange harmony).

Review_Description: Deeply chocolaty, richly floral. Dark chocolate, gently scorched oak, gardenia, lily, raspberry in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of smoky oak and gardenia.
Blind_Assessment: Deeply chocolaty, richly floral. Dark chocolate, gently scorched oak, gardenia, lily, raspberry in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of smoky oak and gardenia.
Notes: Produced at Aquiares Estate, entirely of the Centroamericano variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). David's Nose is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan whose founder studied agronomy and has a deep interest in crop quality. For more information, visit www.dnose.com.tw.
Bottom_Line: A fruit-toned, darker-roasted Costa Rica natural with berry notes alongside dark chocolate and smoky aromatic wood.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-toned, wood-framed. Plum, fresh-cut cedar, lily, cocoa powder, orange zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; delicate, silky mouthfeel. Cocoa nib and orange zest carry the crisp, quiet finish.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately fruit-toned, wood-framed. Plum, fresh-cut cedar, lily, cocoa powder, orange zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; delicate, silky mouthfeel. Cocoa nib and orange zest carry the crisp, quiet finish.
Notes: Produced at Cerro San Luis Micromill, from trees of the Red Bourbon, Orange Bourbon, SL28, Catuai, Villa Sarchi and Maragogype varieties of Arabica, and processed by the white honey method, in which a small amount of fruit flesh is left on the bean during drying. Founded in 2007 and named after the white rhino, which is both rare and social, White Rhino Coffee is based in Dallas, Texas and currently has nine coffee shops in addition to its roastery. Visit whiterhinocoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: Very sweet, delicately composed, with pretty fruit and cocoa notes as throughlines.

Review_Description: Complex, richly floral-toned. Lavender, cocoa nib, starfruit, ginseng, honey in aroma and cup. Bright balanced acidity; vibrant, silky mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish, sweet and multi-layered, fulfills the promise of the cup.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, richly floral-toned. Lavender, cocoa nib, starfruit, ginseng, honey in aroma and cup. Bright balanced acidity; vibrant, silky mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish, sweet and multi-layered, fulfills the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced by Wilder Lasso of Bella Alejandría Farm entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed anaerobic method, in which the fermentation step occurs in a hermetically sealed vessel before the beans are washed and dried. Mostra Coffee is a women-, minority-, veteran-, and immigrant-owned micro-roaster based in north county San Diego. For more information, visit www.mostracoffee.com.
Bottom_Line: A lovely washed anaerobic Colombia Gesha with spicy floral and tropical fruit notes and undercurrents of wild honey throughout the profile.

Review_Description: Sweetly tart, delicately complex. White peach, honeysuckle, tangerine zest, caramel, elm in aroma and cup. Apple-like acidity; vibrant, silky mouthfeel. Quiet but long, harmonious finish.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly tart, delicately complex. White peach, honeysuckle, tangerine zest, caramel, elm in aroma and cup. Apple-like acidity; vibrant, silky mouthfeel. Quiet but long, harmonious finish.
Notes: Produced on HWC Coffee Estate, entirely of the celebrated Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). HWC Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung, Taiwan. For more information, visit www.hwcroasters.com.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered washed Panama Geisha that leads with exhilaratingly high-toned fruit and spicy-sweet floral notes.

Review_Description: Sweetly nut-toned, richly bittersweet. Almond toffee, sarsparilla, lemon verbena, cane sugar, cedar in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cedar and lemon verbena.
Origin: Sitio Pluto, Balutakay, Managa, Davao del Sur, Philippines
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly nut-toned, richly bittersweet. Almond toffee, sarsparilla, lemon verbena, cane sugar, cedar in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of cedar and lemon verbena.
Notes: Produced by Rosemarie Rupecio of the BACOFA Cooperative, entirely of the Catimor variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (some fruit flesh left on the beans during drying). Mostra Coffee is a women-, minority-, veteran-, and immigrant-owned micro-roaster based in north county San Diego. For more information, visit www.mostracoffee.com.
Bottom_Line: A honey-processed Philippine coffee, deeply sweet-savory and nut-driven with undertones of sweet herbs.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory. Cocoa powder, cherry liqueur, pine, marjoram, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Bittersweet with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with hints of cocoa powder and cherry liqueur.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory. Cocoa powder, cherry liqueur, pine, marjoram, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Bittersweet with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with hints of cocoa powder and cherry liqueur.
Notes: Produced on HWC Coffee Estate, entirely of the celebrated Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). HWC Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung, Taiwan. For more information, visit www.hwcroasters.com.
Bottom_Line: An intentionally fermenty, cocoa-toned Panama natural with interesting piney notes and sweet herb undertones.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Fruit Maceration Series Lulo Bear
Review_Description: Confidently fruit-forward. Pineapple yogurt, Concord grape, freesia, marjoram, chocolate syrup in aroma and cup. Crisp, apple-like acidity; full, very syrupy mouthfeel. In the finish, lactic, yogurty tang supported by fruit notes.
Blind_Assessment: Confidently fruit-forward. Pineapple yogurt, Concord grape, freesia, marjoram, chocolate syrup in aroma and cup. Crisp, apple-like acidity; full, very syrupy mouthfeel. In the finish, lactic, yogurty tang supported by fruit notes.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcilo, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic method, in which the coffee is fermented in the whole fruit with limited access to oxygen before drying. With this coffee, both wine yeasts and macerated lulo fruit were added to the ferment tank. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit modcup.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: This anaerobic and fruit-fermented Colombia displays big fruit throughout the profile with undertones of chocolate syrup and sweet herbs.

Review_Description: Delicately floral, richly aromatic. Wisteria, apricot, honey, amber, black tea in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of amber and honey.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately floral, richly aromatic. Wisteria, apricot, honey, amber, black tea in aroma and cup. Gently bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish centers around notes of amber and honey.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed before beans are dried). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A perfumy but delicate Colombia Geisha with a floral throughline and bright stone fruit notes.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Wilton Benitez Double Anaerobic Thermal Shock Yellow Gesha
Review_Description: Richly aromatic, tropical. Passionfruit, ginger, star jasmine, fresh-cut oak, cherry liqueur in aroma and cup. Fruity acidity; viscous, creamy mouthfeel. The spice-toned finish centers around on notes of ginger and cherry liqueur.
Blind_Assessment: Richly aromatic, tropical. Passionfruit, ginger, star jasmine, fresh-cut oak, cherry liqueur in aroma and cup. Fruity acidity; viscous, creamy mouthfeel. The spice-toned finish centers around on notes of ginger and cherry liqueur.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of La Macarena Farm, entirely of the Yellow Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of brewer’s yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit modcup.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: This intense fruit and floral bomb, tempered only by aromatic wood notes, is interesting for its experimental processing, and offers clear appeal for devotees of fruity, floral coffees.

Review_Description: Richly aromatic, deeply savory. Lilac, dark chocolate, goji berry, pomelo, shiitake mushroom in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart-savory structure with bright acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The flavor-laden finish leads with goji berry in the short, rounding to deep chocolate and shiitake notes in the long.
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Richly aromatic, deeply savory. Lilac, dark chocolate, goji berry, pomelo, shiitake mushroom in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart-savory structure with bright acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The flavor-laden finish leads with goji berry in the short, rounding to deep chocolate and shiitake notes in the long.
Notes: Guji is nestled next to Ethiopia's better-known Yirgacheffe and Sidamo growing regions. This is a “natural” or dry-processed coffee (dried in the whole fruit). VERYTIME is a specialty nano-roaster based in Taoyuan, Taiwan. Visit www.verytime.com.tw/ for more information.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered, floral-toned natural-processed Ethiopia cup with complicating umami undertones throughout.

Review_Description: Richly sweet, gently tart. Wisteria, pomegranate, fresh-cut fir, brown sugar, grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of fir, brown sugar and grapefruit zest.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet, gently tart. Wisteria, pomegranate, fresh-cut fir, brown sugar, grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Brisk acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of fir, brown sugar and grapefruit zest.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). VERYTIME is a specialty nano-roaster based in Taoyuan, Taiwan. Visit www.verytime.com.tw/ for more information.
Bottom_Line: A delicately tart, subtly aromatic natural Ethiopia Geisha cup, juicy and inviting.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Finca Sabana Redonda SL28
Review_Description: Fruit-toned, richly sweet-tart. Pomegranate, lemon balm, hazelnut, cocoa nib, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity, plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish leads with notes of pomegranate and cocoa nib.
Origin: Poas Volcano, Alajuela Province, Costa Rica
Blind_Assessment: Fruit-toned, richly sweet-tart. Pomegranate, lemon balm, hazelnut, cocoa nib, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity, plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish leads with notes of pomegranate and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by Francisco Cubillo and Oscar Chacon, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural aerobic method (fermented in the whole fruit in tanks with oxygen exposure), followed by two drying stages. Torque Coffee Roasters has a unique business model that promises 20 percent of the retail value of each coffee to its producer. Visit www.torquecoffees.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A balanced, tartly fruity, cocoa-toned Costa Rica cup with rich aromatic wood notes.

Coffee_Name: Panama Hacienda La Esmeralda Diamond Mountain Catuai Washed
Review_Description: Crisply sweet-tart, citrusy. Lime zest, cocoa nib, jasmine, plum, cedar in aroma and cup. Balanced, vibrant acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned citrus notes lead in the long finish.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart, citrusy. Lime zest, cocoa nib, jasmine, plum, cedar in aroma and cup. Balanced, vibrant acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned citrus notes lead in the long finish.
Notes: Produced at Hacienda La Esmeralda, entirely of the Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed before beans are dried). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A Catuai from famed Panama Geisha producer Hacienda La Esmeralda — complex, cocoa and citrus driven.

Review_Description: Brightly sweet, vibrant. Nectarine, hazelnut, grapefruit zest, fresh-cut oak, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of hazelnut and grapefruit.
Blind_Assessment: Brightly sweet, vibrant. Nectarine, hazelnut, grapefruit zest, fresh-cut oak, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of hazelnut and grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by Arturo Aguirre of El Injerto Farm, from trees of the Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed before beans are dried). Ba Yang Coffee is a specialty roaster based in New Taipei City, Taiwan.  Visit www.ruten.com.tw/store/kiki9i/ for more information.

Coffee_Name: Yemen Al Kawlah Special Reserve Natural
Review_Description: Richly fruit-toned, chocolaty. Dark chocolate, red currant, tangerine zest, oak, honey in aroma and cup. Winy acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, citrus-driven finish, invitingly bittersweet.
Blind_Assessment: Richly fruit-toned, chocolaty. Dark chocolate, red currant, tangerine zest, oak, honey in aroma and cup. Winy acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, citrus-driven finish, invitingly bittersweet.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Yemenia variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). For more information, visit www.ramsheadcoffee.com.

Review_Description: Richly nut-toned, very sweet. Toffee, hazelnut, magnolia, green grape, marjoram in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy-sweet acidity; lively, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish that harmoniously carries forward all the notes from the cup.
Origin: Holualoa, Kona, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind_Assessment: Richly nut-toned, very sweet. Toffee, hazelnut, magnolia, green grape, marjoram in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy-sweet acidity; lively, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant finish that harmoniously carries forward all the notes from the cup.
Notes: Produced at Noelani Farm, entirely of the K7 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Review_Description: Richly aromatic, floral, spice-toned. Orange blossom, dark chocolate, agave, cedar, cardamom in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory structure with high-toned acidity; viscous, full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to orange blossom and cardamom.
Origin: El Chaco Canton, Parroquia Santa Rosa, Napo Province, Ecuador
Blind_Assessment: Richly aromatic, floral, spice-toned. Orange blossom, dark chocolate, agave, cedar, cardamom in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory structure with high-toned acidity; viscous, full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to orange blossom and cardamom.
Notes: Produced by Leopoldo Andrade of La Josefina Estate, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Magnolia Coffee is a Charlotte-based specialty roaster whose mission is to use sustainably sourced coffees to make a difference in the lives of coffee workers and to foster a socially conscious community with cause-supporting coffees. Bottom_Line: An impressive example of the rare Sidra variety, nuanced and deep, with impulses ranging from sweet to spice-toned, floral to fruity.

Review_Description: Deeply sweet, fruit-forward. Bing cherry, dark chocolate, marshmallow, cashew, lime zest in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The cleanly fruit-toned finish shows undertones of cashew and dark chocolate.
Origin: Bonga Forest, Keficho-Shekicho Zone, southwest Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Deeply sweet, fruit-forward. Bing cherry, dark chocolate, marshmallow, cashew, lime zest in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The cleanly fruit-toned finish shows undertones of cashew and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced at Dehab Mesfin Farm, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Jaunt Coffee Roasters is a San Diego-based roaster and café with an extensive coffee and food menu. Visit www.jauntcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A vibrant, cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia cup, delicately fruit-driven, with an especially rich, creamy mouthfeel.

Review_Description: Complex, sweetly spice-toned. Dark caramel, tea rose, clove, pear, myrrh in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet with malic acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The crisply sweet finish consolidates to notes of clove and pear.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, sweetly spice-toned. Dark caramel, tea rose, clove, pear, myrrh in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet with malic acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The crisply sweet finish consolidates to notes of clove and pear.
Notes: Produced by the Adolfo family of Finca Colombia, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by Mario Valiente by the semi-washed or honey method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but some of the fruit flesh is allowed to dry on the beans. For more information, visit www.ramsheadcoffee.com.
Bottom_Line: A spice-toned, semi-washed (honey) El Salvador with deep floral and rich spice notes and an especially syrupy body.

Review_Description: Chocolaty-sweet. Dark chocolate, magnolia, almond butter, mandarin zest, date in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, nut-toned finish.
Blind_Assessment: Chocolaty-sweet. Dark chocolate, magnolia, almond butter, mandarin zest, date in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty, nut-toned finish.

Review_Description: Fruit-forward, sweetly tart. Dried raspberry, persimmon, baking chocolate, nutmeg, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Berry-toned finish with hints of baking chocolate.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly sweet-tart. Lychee, Meyer lemon zest, agave syrup, cocoa nib, narcissus in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The floral-toned finish centers around notes of narcissus and Meyer lemon zest.
Blind_Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet-tart. Lychee, Meyer lemon zest, agave syrup, cocoa nib, narcissus in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The floral-toned finish centers around notes of narcissus and Meyer lemon zest.
Notes: Produced by women members of Turihamwe, a group founded in 2019 whose name means “together we can.” Produced entirely from trees of the Bourbon variety of Arabica and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh removed before drying). Review_Description: Richly sweet, berry-toned. Blackberry, salted caramel, pink grapefruit zest, lemon balm, oak in aroma and cup. Balanced, bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to caramel and citrus notes.

Review_Description: Complexly fruit-layered, floral. Star jasmine, wild raspberry, lychee, cocoa nib, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Juicy-bright acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish centers around notes of cocoa-toned raspberry and sandalwood.
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia

Notes: Southern Ethiopia coffees like this one are largely produced from selections of traditional Ethiopian landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the natural anaerobic method in which the coffee is fermented in the whole fruit with limited access to oxygen before drying. Ironclad Coffee Roasters, a micro-roaster in Richmond, Virginia derives its name from its ironclad guarantee of top quality specialty coffee and dedicated customer service. For more information visit www.ironcladcoffee.com.

Review_Description: Fruit-driven, deeply sweet. Dried raspberry, dark chocolate, wisteria, wild honey, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart, high-toned acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of raspberry and wisteria with a continuing hint of wine barrel.
Origin: Werka, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from traditional varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Review_Description: Delicately sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, apple butter, pistachio, cocoa nib, lilac in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with lively acidity; silky mouthfeel. The cocoa-toned finish is supported by notes of bergamot and lilac.

Review_Description: Complex, sweetly savory. Yellow plum, saltwater taffy, lemon thyme, agave syrup, freesia in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Sweet fruit in the finish with herb undertones.

Review_Description: Crisply chocolaty, richly sweet. Baking chocolate, Graham cracker, pink peppercorn, green apple, caramel in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Chocolate and spice-toned finish.
Origin: Cijapati, Garut Regency, West Java, Indonesia

Bottom_Line: An unusually composed washed Java with crisply tart fruit, rich chocolate and delicate spice notes throughout.

Review_Description: Chocolaty, richly sweet. Dark chocolate, hazelnut, gardenia, date, cedar in aroma and cup. Very gentle acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolate-toned, nutty finish.
Blind_Assessment: Chocolaty, richly sweet. Dark chocolate, hazelnut, gardenia, date, cedar in aroma and cup. Very gentle acidity; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolate-toned, nutty finish.
Notes: A blend of two coffees, a traditionally washed Colombia and a honey-processed Honduras. Wishingvine is a Taichung, Taiwan specialty coffee roaster. Visit https://wishingvinecoffee.com/ for more information.

Review_Description: Roasty-sweet, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, roasted almond, gently scorched oak, shortbread cookie, narcissus in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate, scorched oak, and almond.
Blind_Assessment: Roasty-sweet, crisply chocolaty. Baking chocolate, roasted almond, gently scorched oak, shortbread cookie, narcissus in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate, scorched oak, and almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Kulatik Cooperative, from trees of the Typica, Bourbon and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit regentcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A deep-toned Chiapas cup with a throughline of crisp chocolate and almond, roast-rounded and sweet.

Review_Description: High-toned, lush, complexly fruity. Lychee, starfruit, wisteria, lemon thyme, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet with elegant, balanced acidity; lyrically silky mouthfeel. Notes of lychee, wisteria and cocoa nib carry far into a long, lingering finish.
Blind_Assessment: High-toned, lush, complexly fruity. Lychee, starfruit, wisteria, lemon thyme, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet with elegant, balanced acidity; lyrically silky mouthfeel. Notes of lychee, wisteria and cocoa nib carry far into a long, lingering finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Peña of Finca La Papaya, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums.
