Bottom_Line: A fine example of what a Geisha natural from Ecuador can achieve: stunning aromatics, lush complexity throughout the profile, and fruit-forward with finesse.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Tolima Finca El Vergel Rebel Geisha
Review_Description: Complex, multi-layered. Green oolong, rosehips, sandalwood, gingko, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and and cup. Exceptionally sweet with elegant acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Richly resonant, sweetly tart finish.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, multi-layered. Green oolong, rosehips, sandalwood, gingko, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and and cup. Exceptionally sweet with elegant acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Richly resonant, sweetly tart finish.
Notes: Produced by Marta Bayter and her sons, Shady and Elias, of Vergel Estate. Composed entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey or semi-washed method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but some of the fruit flesh is allowed to dry on the beans. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/iamjiter for more information.
Bottom_Line: An enticingly rich Colombia Geisha aromatic fireworks whose promise is fulfilled in the cup with deep oolong-like impulses and sweet citrus zest.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Buenos Aires Honey Process-Yellow Velvet Peach
Review_Description: Fruit-toned, tropical. Strawberry-guava, freesia, ginseng, elm, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet, juicy acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, complex finish that leads with ginseng notes, followed by cocoa nib.
Blind_Assessment: Fruit-toned, tropical. Strawberry-guava, freesia, ginseng, elm, cocoa nib in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet, juicy acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, complex finish that leads with ginseng notes, followed by cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced at Finca Buenos Aires, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying, in this case, with the addition of peaches to the fermentation.  Ingenuity Coffee Roastery is a specialty coffee roaster based in Changhua, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/etmax123 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A powerfully aromatic, flavor-saturated, experimentally processed Colombia cup that has been co-fermented with peaches.

Review_Description: Tropical-fruity, richly aromatic. Guava, passionflower, tangerine zest, macadamia nut, marjoram in aroma and cup. Complexly layered with punchy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Sweet herb notes highlight a long, savory finish.
Blind_Assessment: Tropical-fruity, richly aromatic. Guava, passionflower, tangerine zest, macadamia nut, marjoram in aroma and cup. Complexly layered with punchy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Sweet herb notes highlight a long, savory finish.
Notes: A blend of two coffees: a double-anaerobic washed Costa Rica Catuai and a natural-processed Ethiopia Geisha. Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/iamjiter for more information.
Bottom_Line: An unabashedly fruit-forward Costa Rica/Ethiopia blend that achieves balance and depth from sweet herb and citrus zest.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Sidama Arbegona Duwancho Cooperative G1
Review_Description: Sweetly savory, rich-toned. Pipe tobacco, golden raisin, lilac, almond, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet structure with winy acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. The finish centers on notes of golden raisin and pipe tobacco.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly savory, rich-toned. Pipe tobacco, golden raisin, lilac, almond, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet structure with winy acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. The finish centers on notes of golden raisin and pipe tobacco.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Duwancho Cooperative,  from trees of the 74110, 74112 and 74158 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the black honey method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but virtually all of the fruit flesh is allowed to dry slowly on the beans, often resulting in a deep, pungent profile. Ingenuity Coffee Roastery is a specialty coffee roaster based in Changhua, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/etmax123 for more information.
Bottom_Line: An inviting black honey-processed Ethiopia — rich, round, deeply aromatic.

Review_Description: Sweetly nut-toned. Pecan butter, baking chocolate, orange zest, sassafras, nutmeg in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with mild acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to pecan and orange zest.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly nut-toned. Pecan butter, baking chocolate, orange zest, sassafras, nutmeg in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with mild acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to pecan and orange zest.
Notes: Produced by Agrocomercial Santa Felisa, S.A., entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans while they dry. Riika Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster based in New Taipei City, Taiwan. Email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A friendly, nut-driven Guatemala cup with undertones of bittersweet citrus zest.

Review_Description: Crisp, richly sweet. Cocoa nib, dried nectarine, narcissus, hazelnut, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa-toned nectarine.
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Crisp, richly sweet. Cocoa nib, dried nectarine, narcissus, hazelnut, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa-toned nectarine.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a dry-processed or “natural” version, meaning the beans were dried inside the fruit rather than after the fruit has been removed, as is the case with wet-processed or “washed” coffees. Jebena Coffees is a Dubai-based custom-built roasting facility with a temperature- and humidity-controlled storage area and a professional cupping lab. Jebena offers coffees for both retail and wholesale purchase, as well as coffee training at every level. Visit www.jebenacoffees.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A juicy-sweet, balanced Ethiopia natural characterized by bright stone fruit and cocoa nib throughout the profile.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Oreo cookie, finger lime, lychee, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Lively, brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. A hint of cumin surfaces in the cookie-sweet finish.
Blind_Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Oreo cookie, finger lime, lychee, agave syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Lively, brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. A hint of cumin surfaces in the cookie-sweet finish.
Notes: A USDA-certified organic coffee from Cusco, Peru (San Fernando Cooperative), processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Wonderstate Coffee, formerly Kickapoo Coffee, is an award-winning roaster based in rural Wisconsin known for its commitment to guaranteeing higher pay for farmers and operating the country’s first 100% solar-powered roastery. Visit wonderstate.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A satisfying organic Peru with sweet chocolate and lime notes complicated by subtle spice tones.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Passionfruit, scorched sandalwood, violet, tangerine, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Gentle but juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Honey-like, floral finish with legs.
Blind_Assessment: Deep-toned, richly sweet. Passionfruit, scorched sandalwood, violet, tangerine, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Gentle but juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Honey-like, floral finish with legs.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). MK Coffee Roasters, a short walk from the Shulin train station in New Taipei City, specializes in high-quality roasted beans to take home and expertly brewed coffees to enjoy in the café. Visit www.mkcoffee.com.tw or e-mail [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A big, resonant dark-roast Kenya that preserves origin character and offers up sweetly tart fruit, delicate floral and rich aromatic wood notes with a not-too-roasty edge.

Review_Description: Vibrant, deep, elegant. Grape jelly, roasted coconut, violet, scorched clove, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with tangy acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Complex smoky-sweet finish with grape and scorched clove notes.
Origin: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawai’i
Blind_Assessment: Vibrant, deep, elegant. Grape jelly, roasted coconut, violet, scorched clove, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with tangy acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. Complex smoky-sweet finish with grape and scorched clove notes.
Notes: SL34 and SL28 are varieties of Arabica famous for producing the great classic coffees of Kenya. Hula Daddy is a boutique coffee producer with farms at the 1,400- and 2,500-foot levels of the Mount Hualalai volcano near the northern end of the Kona growing district, above the town of Kailua-Kona. This SL34 coffee was produced at the higher-elevation Hula Daddy farm and processed with an anaerobic ferment step using commercial yeast. Visit www.huladaddy.com or call 808-327-9744 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A mesmerizing darker-roasted Kona SL34 with brightly sweet fruit and delicate florals against a backdrop of richly aromatic scorched clove.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Lucy Station Dark Roast
Review_Description: Roasty-sweet, floral-toned. Honeysuckle, date, scorched birch, dark chocolate, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of lemon and honeysuckle.
Blind_Assessment: Roasty-sweet, floral-toned. Honeysuckle, date, scorched birch, dark chocolate, Meyer lemon zest in aroma and cup. Crisp, juicy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of lemon and honeysuckle.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans, and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan, that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected].
Bottom_Line: A surprisingly bright dark-roasted Ethiopia Gesha with a throughline of pretty florals and rich chocolate notes.

Review_Description: Chocolaty and sweetly herbaceous. Dark chocolate, dried peach, sage, narcissus, scorched cedar in aroma and cup. Complex sweet-savory structure with rich, balanced acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to smoky chocolate and sage notes.
Blind_Assessment: Chocolaty and sweetly herbaceous. Dark chocolate, dried peach, sage, narcissus, scorched cedar in aroma and cup. Complex sweet-savory structure with rich, balanced acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to smoky chocolate and sage notes.
Notes: In addition to his retail roasting operation, Aroma Roast Coffees, Simon Hsieh also operates Soaring Phoenix Trading, a business focused on purpose-built commercial espresso blends and high-quality single-origin coffees. Customers can also visit the new showroom, Chateau Andy, in Taipei City. Visit facebook.com/4ArtsZeroDefectCoffees or call 886-0983-749876 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A deeply satisfying, rich-toned, dark-roasted Kenya with smoky herb notes, dried stone fruit, and spicy florals.

Review_Description: Berry-toned, richly floral, chocolaty. Mulberry, dark chocolate, lily, scorched oak, a hint of brandy in aroma and cup. Bittersweet with round, juicy acidity; lightly syrupy, supple mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated finish, crisp and sweet.
Blind_Assessment: Berry-toned, richly floral, chocolaty. Mulberry, dark chocolate, lily, scorched oak, a hint of brandy in aroma and cup. Bittersweet with round, juicy acidity; lightly syrupy, supple mouthfeel. Long, flavor-saturated finish, crisp and sweet.
Notes: Produced at Kenya Embu Guchinda Estate from trees of the SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Roaster Yu Chih Hao is co-founder of Fumi Coffee, a roaster in Hsinchu, Taiwan, specializing in specialty coffee and homemade desserts. Visit https://m.facebook.com/fumicafe035586631/ for more information.
Bottom_Line: A complex, rich-toned, moderately dark-roasted Kenya driven by dark berry fruit, deep chocolate, and sweet floral notes.

Review_Description: Cocoa-centric, gently spice-toned. Baking chocolate, pink peppercorn, orange blossom, dried blueberry, oak in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with gently tart acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of dried blueberry.
Blind_Assessment: Cocoa-centric, gently spice-toned. Baking chocolate, pink peppercorn, orange blossom, dried blueberry, oak in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with gently tart acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of dried blueberry.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Gedeb and Halo Bariti cooperatives from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Founded by Brad Katz, a music lover and home coffee roaster, Bassline Coffee aims to offer something for every kind of coffee lover with roasts that bring out the inherent qualities of diverse green coffees. Visit www.basslinecoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered Ethiopia natural, vibrantly spice-toned and sweetly floral.

Review_Description: Richly bittersweet, fruity. Guava, walnut, kefir, scorched redwood, lemon curd in aroma and cup. Complex, sweet-savory structure with fruit-toned acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisply tart, nutty finish.
Blind_Assessment: Richly bittersweet, fruity. Guava, walnut, kefir, scorched redwood, lemon curd in aroma and cup. Complex, sweet-savory structure with fruit-toned acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Crisply tart, nutty finish.
Notes: A blend composed of four coffees: two from Colombia, one washed and one honey processed; a natural Panama; and a washed Papua New Guinea. Balmy Day Coffee Office is a specialty nano-roastery based in Taoyuan, Taiwan. For more information, visit facebook.com/Balmydaycoffee.
Bottom_Line: An exceptionally bright dark-roast coffee complicated by crisp nut and rich aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Richly fruit- and spice-toned. Blackberry, scorchy cardamom, cherry blossom, Graham cracker, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Sweetly deep with lyrically bright acidity; lightly creamy mouthfeel. The crisp finish centers around cardamom and cocoa powder.
Blind_Assessment: Richly fruit- and spice-toned. Blackberry, scorchy cardamom, cherry blossom, Graham cracker, cocoa powder in aroma and cup. Sweetly deep with lyrically bright acidity; lightly creamy mouthfeel. The crisp finish centers around cardamom and cocoa powder.
Notes: This version of Mokha Java is composed of 50% medium-dark washed Ethiopia (currently Tega Tula), 20% dark-roast Pacific Island coffee (currently PNG Siane Chimbu), 20% medium-light natural Ethiopia (currently Shantawene), and 10% light washed Ethiopia (currently Suke Quto). Speckled Ax is a roaster based in Portland, Maine, specializing in high-quality certified organic and small-lot coffees. The company roasts in a vintage wood-fired Petroncini roaster with the goal of highlighting each coffee’s best attributes. Visit www.speckledax.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A complex variation on the classic Mokha Java theme, in this case Ethiopia-heavy, with depth from a Papua New Guinea. Redolent with blackberry and cardamom.

Review_Description: Sweetly earthy, floral-toned. Pipe tobacco, jasmine, pink grapefruit zest, pistachio, plum in aroma and cup. Gently tart acidity; crisp, creamy mouthfeel. Richly smoky, sweetly nutty finish.
Origin: Paranginan, Humbahas Province, Karo Highlands, Sumatra, Indonesia
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly earthy, floral-toned. Pipe tobacco, jasmine, pink grapefruit zest, pistachio, plum in aroma and cup. Gently tart acidity; crisp, creamy mouthfeel. Richly smoky, sweetly nutty finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from trees of the Tim Tim, Catimor and Lasuna varieties of Arabica and processed by the locally traditional washed and wet-hulled method. Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit www.revelcoffee.com or call 406-534-9621 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A complex, nutty, floral, sweetly earthy cup: classic Sumatra right down to the distinct pipe tobacco notes.

Review_Description: : Sweetly earth-toned, floral. Vanilla orchid, scorched oak, pipe tobacco, unsweetened cocoa, cashew in aroma and cup. Roasty-sweet with balanced acidity; light, rather fluffy mouthfeel. Earthy, pungent finish with notes of scorched oak and sweet pipe tobacco.
Blind_Assessment: : Sweetly earth-toned, floral. Vanilla orchid, scorched oak, pipe tobacco, unsweetened cocoa, cashew in aroma and cup. Roasty-sweet with balanced acidity; light, rather fluffy mouthfeel. Earthy, pungent finish with notes of scorched oak and sweet pipe tobacco.
Notes: Produced at the Simalem Estate in the Karo Regency of North Sumatra from nanolots originating around Lake Toba and processed by the traditional Sumatra washed and wet-hulled method. Vermont Artisan Coffee & Tea provides craft-roasted coffees and quality teas to retail establishments, food service markets, and retail customers throughout New England and beyond. For more information, visit www.vtartisan.com.
Bottom_Line: For fans of overtly earthy coffees, this Sumatra, with its sweet pipe tobacco and floral vanilla tones, fits the bill.

Review_Description: Roasty, rich, earthy-sweet. Cocoa powder, tamarind, scorched cedar, cashew brittle, fresh humus in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish with notes of cocoa powder and scorched cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Roasty, rich, earthy-sweet. Cocoa powder, tamarind, scorched cedar, cashew brittle, fresh humus in aroma and cup. Gentle, round acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish with notes of cocoa powder and scorched cedar.
Notes: Peet’s Coffee, now a national chain, was founded by Alfred Peet in 1966, making it one of the first and most influential specialty coffee roasters in the U.S. Visit www.peets.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A dark-roasted twist on the Mocha Java blend from a national chain that is a widely accessible go-to in the U.S. when you’re in the mood for deep, dark familiarity.

Review_Description: Bright, richly aromatic. Bergamot, apricot, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, honey in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel.The harmonious finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and bergamot.
Origin: Wenago Woreda, Gedeo Zone, SNNP, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Bright, richly aromatic. Bergamot, apricot, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, honey in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with sparkling acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel.The harmonious finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and bergamot.
Notes: Produced by Hamed Awol, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the washed method, including the addition during the fermentation stage of a special cultured yeast developed specifically for washed-process coffees. Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit www.revelcoffee.com or call 406-534-9621 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A bright yeast-processed Ethiopia with a throughline of cocoa nib and citrus notes — rich, juicy, high-toned.

Review_Description: Multi-layered, deep-toned. Dark chocolate, blackberry marjoram, praline, cedar in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet with brisk acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The balanced finish centers around blackberry and chocolate notes.
Origin: La Coipa, San Ignacio, Cajamarca, Peru
Blind_Assessment: Multi-layered, deep-toned. Dark chocolate, blackberry marjoram, praline, cedar in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet with brisk acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The balanced finish centers around blackberry and chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced by Maria Nieves from trees of the Bourbon, Caturra and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A quietly complete Peru cup with deep berry, rich chocolate, and aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Richly sweet-tart. Black currant, hazelnut, cocoa nib, freesia, maple syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish with cedar undertones.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-tart. Black currant, hazelnut, cocoa nib, freesia, maple syrup, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; silky, viscous mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Kagumo Farmers Cooperative Society, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit www.revelcoffee.com or call 406-534-9621 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A classic Kenya cup with particularly inviting, juicy-bright acidity grounded by engaging black currant notes, the hallmark of the origin.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet, balanced, rich. Caramel, baking chocolate, orange bitters, hazelnut butter, pie cherry in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of creamy hazelnut and orange
Origin: Wamena growing region, West Papua, New Guinea
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet, balanced, rich. Caramel, baking chocolate, orange bitters, hazelnut butter, pie cherry in aroma and cup. Bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of creamy hazelnut and orange
Notes: The first coffee from West Papua ever to be exported to North America or Europe. Processed by the conventional fully washed method, which is anomalous in this growing region, actually a province of Indonesia, where Indonesian-style washing and wet-hulling is more typical. In partnership with Cafe Imports, Roadmap is donating $7 from the sale of each bag to Grounds for Health, a non-profit that provides women’s healthcare in coffee-producing communities. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom_Line: This conventionally washed-process coffee from West Papua, New Guinea, an Indonesian province better known for its rustic wet-hulled coffees, is sweet, complex, chocolaty and nutty.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Turrialba Volcano Honey Process
Review_Description: Fruit-toned, deeply sweet-tart. Blackberry, brown sugar, dark chocolate, cedar, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Bright and juicy with lively acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with undertones of brown sugar and cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Fruit-toned, deeply sweet-tart. Blackberry, brown sugar, dark chocolate, cedar, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Bright and juicy with lively acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with undertones of brown sugar and cedar.
Notes: Produced on the slopes of Turrialba Volcano at Aquiares Farm, and processed by the honey method (some of the fruit flesh is left on the bean while drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A richly fruit-toned honey-processed Ethiopia cup centered around notes of berries and spice-toned florals.

Review_Description: Balanced, richly sweet. Apricot, baking chocolate, almond, Meyer lemon zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned almond and bittersweet lemon zest.
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, richly sweet. Apricot, baking chocolate, almond, Meyer lemon zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned almond and bittersweet lemon zest.
Notes: Produced by members of the Adame Garbota Cooperative and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: An inviting washed Ethiopia cup with depth from cocoa notes and a rich bittersweetness from citrus zest.

Review_Description: Gently fruit-toned. Dried cranberry, agave syrup, freesia, cedar, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quietly fruity finish with undertones of spicy florals.
Blind_Assessment: Gently fruit-toned. Dried cranberry, agave syrup, freesia, cedar, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quietly fruity finish with undertones of spicy florals.
Notes: Produced by Newerley Gutierrez of Finca Monteverde, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Yipao Coffee Roasters, based in San Diego, was founded by two native Colombians who specialize in single-origin Colombia coffees. Visit www.yipao-coffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A balanced, easygoing natural-processed Colombia Geisha with engaging fruit, floral and herb notes.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Washed Yirgacheffe Gedeb Worka Chelchele
Review_Description: High-toned, richly sweet-savory. Plum, tangerine, narcissus, cedar, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Vibrant structure with balanced, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of plum and tangerine supported by maple syrup suggestions.
Blind_Assessment: High-toned, richly sweet-savory. Plum, tangerine, narcissus, cedar, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Vibrant structure with balanced, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of plum and tangerine supported by maple syrup suggestions.
Notes: Coffees like this one from the Yirgacheffe growing region are largely produced from selections of traditional Ethiopian landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a wet-processed or “washed” version (fruit skin and flesh are removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A juicy, citrus- and floral-toned washed Ethiopia as deep as it is bright.

Review_Description: Complex, deep-toned. Apricot, pink grapefruit zest, salted caramel, cedar, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Crisp, sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit, apricot and cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, deep-toned. Apricot, pink grapefruit zest, salted caramel, cedar, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Crisp, sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; satiny mouthfeel. Finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit, apricot and cedar.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bargain Cafe is a specialty coffee roaster in Taitung, Taiwan. Visit https://shopee.tw/iamjiter for more information.
Bottom_Line: A washed Ethiopia redolent of stone fruit and salted caramel; juicy-sweet and rich.

Review_Description: Aromatic, sweet-savory, big-bodied. Grapefruit, dark chocolate, cedar, sarsaparilla, ginger blossom in aroma and cup. Sweetly brisk with plush, viscous mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates in a simple, resonant finish around notes of grapefruit and cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Aromatic, sweet-savory, big-bodied. Grapefruit, dark chocolate, cedar, sarsaparilla, ginger blossom in aroma and cup. Sweetly brisk with plush, viscous mouthfeel. Flavor consolidates in a simple, resonant finish around notes of grapefruit and cedar.
Notes: Yirgacheffe is a coffee region in southern Ethiopia that produces distinctive coffees largely from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. This example is processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed before drying). RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit www.ramsheadcoffee.com.
Bottom_Line: A hearty washed Ethiopia characterized by sweet-tart grapefruit and richly aromatic cedar, softened by dark chocolate tones.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Huila Finca El Triunfo Martha Zuñiga Pink Bourbon
Review_Description: Richly aromatic, deep-toned. Wild strawberry, lemon curd, roasted almond, narcissus, tangerine zest in aroma and small cup. Bright and juicy with sparkling acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. The long finish centers around notes of lemon curd and almond.
Blind_Assessment: Richly aromatic, deep-toned. Wild strawberry, lemon curd, roasted almond, narcissus, tangerine zest in aroma and small cup. Bright and juicy with sparkling acidity; full, satiny mouthfeel. The long finish centers around notes of lemon curd and almond.
Notes: Produced by Martha Zuñiga of Finca El Triunfo, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying. RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit www.ramsheadcoffee.com.
Bottom_Line: A delightfully deep yet playful anaerobic natural Colombia Pink Bourbon that demonstrates varietal character throughout the cup — juicy, fruity, balanced.

Review_Description: Fruit-forward, balanced and juicy. Dried apricot, dark chocolate, pink grapefruit zest, hazelnut brittle, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with brisk acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with notes of dried apricot and hazelnut.
Blind_Assessment: Fruit-forward, balanced and juicy. Dried apricot, dark chocolate, pink grapefruit zest, hazelnut brittle, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with brisk acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with notes of dried apricot and hazelnut.
Notes: Produced at Finca Mirazu, entirely of the SL28 variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Coffeeland is a specialty coffee roastery with two locations, one in Chia-Yi, Taiwan, and one in Ontario, California. Visit www.coffeeland.com/tw.
Bottom_Line: Produced from trees of the admired SL28 variety, originating in Kenya but grown in Costa Rica, here processed by the natural method: juicy, chocolaty, citrusy and deep.

Review_Description: Sweet, cocoa-toned, wood-framed. Cocoa powder, raisin, cashew, elm, shiitake mushroom in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of cashew and fir.
Blind_Assessment: Sweet, cocoa-toned, wood-framed. Cocoa powder, raisin, cashew, elm, shiitake mushroom in aroma and cup. Briskly sweet acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of cashew and fir.
Notes: A blend comprised of coffees from five origins: Ethiopia, Brazil, India, Indonesia and Guatemala. Heat Coffee is a nano-roaster in Taipei, Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest-quality coffee. Visit https://www.facebook.com/heatcoffee768 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A friendly, accessible blend with warm earth and crisp cocoa tones supported by rich aromatic wood.

Review_Description: Bright, crisp, sweet-toned. Almond brittle, Pink Lady apple, baking chocolate, oak, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; plush, viscous mouthfeel. Crisp, sweetly nutty finish.
Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala
Blind_Assessment: Bright, crisp, sweet-toned. Almond brittle, Pink Lady apple, baking chocolate, oak, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; plush, viscous mouthfeel. Crisp, sweetly nutty finish.
Notes: Produced by Anthony Medina of Finca La Colina, entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Imported by Primavera Coffee. Succulent Coffee Roasters is a Southern California specialty roaster and coffee shop founded in 2019. Visit www.succulentcoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A straight-ahead, comfortable Guatemala cup with a throughline of sweet nut and crisp apple notes and an especially rich mouthfeel.

Review_Description: Balanced, floral, sweetly spice-toned. Magnolia, almond butter, ginger cookie, sugarcane, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; lightly satiny, very smooth mouthfeel. The crisp, richly sweet finish centers around sugarcane and almond.
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, floral, sweetly spice-toned. Magnolia, almond butter, ginger cookie, sugarcane, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; lightly satiny, very smooth mouthfeel. The crisp, richly sweet finish centers around sugarcane and almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of the Bukeye Commune, entirely of Bourbon-related varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Imported by Kafe Kreyol. Succulent Coffee Roasters is a Southern California specialty roaster and coffee shop founded in 2019. Visit www.succulentcoffeeroasters.com for more information
Bottom_Line: An attractively complex, deeply layered, floral- and spice-toned Burundi.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Bench-Maji Lucy Station Washed Geisha
Review_Description: Multi-layered, sweetly tart. Freesia, pink grapefruit zest, nectarine, cedar, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Crisp, sweetly tart structure with bright acidity; delicate, silky mouthfeel. Pink grapefruit, nectarine and cedar notes carry the crisp finish.
Blind_Assessment: Multi-layered, sweetly tart. Freesia, pink grapefruit zest, nectarine, cedar, bay leaf in aroma and cup. Crisp, sweetly tart structure with bright acidity; delicate, silky mouthfeel. Pink grapefruit, nectarine and cedar notes carry the crisp finish.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit shopee.tw/zengkaochen for more information.
Bottom_Line: A floral, sweetly citrusy washed Ethiopia, richly aromatic and bright.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Sidamo Faysel Abdosh Anaerobic Natural
Review_Description: Sweetly fermenty, richly aromatic. Raspberry brandy, lilac, mint, cocoa nib, yogurt in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with citrusy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Rich-toned finish with notes of mint and raspberry brandy.
Origin: Ethiopia Sidamo Faysel Abdosh Anaerobic Natural
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly fermenty, richly aromatic. Raspberry brandy, lilac, mint, cocoa nib, yogurt in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with citrusy acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. Rich-toned finish with notes of mint and raspberry brandy.
Notes: Produced by Faysel Abdosh, from trees of the 774110 and 74158 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before drying. Regent strives to deliver coffee with care and purpose. Visit regentcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: An intentionally fermenty Ethiopia anaerobic cup with juicy berry notes, lactic tang, and sweet herbs throughout.

Review_Description: Richly sweet-savory, multi-layered. Blackberry, dark chocolate, salted caramel, fresh-cut cedar, narcissus in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-savory structure with juicy-bright acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. The long finish leads with dark chocolate and narcissus.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, multi-layered. Blackberry, dark chocolate, salted caramel, fresh-cut cedar, narcissus in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-savory structure with juicy-bright acidity; plush, creamy mouthfeel. The long finish leads with dark chocolate and narcissus.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Ngariama Cooperative Society, from trees of the SL28, Ruiru 11 and Batian varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bird Rock Coffee Roasters is a retailer and wholesaler focused on organic and socially responsible coffees; it was named the “2012 Micro-Roaster of the Year” by Roast Magazine. Visit www.birdrockcoffee.com or call 858-551-1707 for more information.
Bottom_Line: This classic Kenya displays dark berry and rich chocolate notes vibrantlly juxtaposed with spicy florals and salted caramel.

Review_Description: Balanced, bright, deep-toned. Pomegranate, Graham cracker, tangerine, baking chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with lively acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of tangerine and baking chocolate with undertones of cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, bright, deep-toned. Pomegranate, Graham cracker, tangerine, baking chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with lively acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of tangerine and baking chocolate with undertones of cedar.
Notes: Produced by Juan Diego de la Cerda, entirely of the Maracaturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Maracaturra is a cross between the huge-beaned Maragogipe and the compact-growing Caturra varieties of Arabica. Bird Rock Coffee Roasters is a retailer and wholesaler focused on organic and socially responsible coffees; it was named the “2012 Micro-Roaster of the Year” by Roast Magazine. Visit www.birdrockcoffee.com or call 858-551-1707 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A harmonious, integrated Guatemala Maracaturra with elegant depth and perky acidity.

Review_Description: Chocolaty, floral-driven. Baking chocolate, honeysuckle, fig newton, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Baking chocolate and honeysuckle, supported by cedar, carry the finish.
Blind_Assessment: Chocolaty, floral-driven. Baking chocolate, honeysuckle, fig newton, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Baking chocolate and honeysuckle, supported by cedar, carry the finish.
Notes: Produced by Luis Pedro Zelaya Zamora entirely of the Bourbon variety of Arabica and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information.
Bottom_Line: The deep floral character of this Guatemala is supported by crisp chocolate and sweet herb. Particularly plush, viscous mouthfeel.

Review_Description: Fruit- and cocoa-toned. Raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with even-keeled acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. Jammy, herbaceous finish.
Blind_Assessment: Fruit- and cocoa-toned. Raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with even-keeled acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. Jammy, herbaceous finish.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding Huye Mountain Washing Station, entirely of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and flesh are removed from the beans before they are dried). Bottom_Line: A confident, familiar, satisfying Rwanda with notes of red berry up front, complicated by pleasing bittersweet citrus and crisp cocoa nib throughout.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Bench Maji Geisha Lucy Station
Review_Description: Floral-toned, sweetly citrusy. Magrut lime, star jasmine, salted almond, fresh-cut oak, honey in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet structure with brightly tart acidity; very silky, viscous mouthfeel. Citrusy and floral-toned finish.
Blind_Assessment: Floral-toned, sweetly citrusy. Magrut lime, star jasmine, salted almond, fresh-cut oak, honey in aroma and cup. Juicy-sweet structure with brightly tart acidity; very silky, viscous mouthfeel. Citrusy and floral-toned finish.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It is processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected].
Bottom_Line: A very pretty washed Ethiopia Geisha with complex citrus and spice-toned florals, and a compelling umami undercurrent.

Review_Description: Balanced, bright, juicy. Lemon curd, salted caramel, bosc pear, almond brittle, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with high-toned acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, integrated finish.
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, bright, juicy. Lemon curd, salted caramel, bosc pear, almond brittle, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with high-toned acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, integrated finish.
Notes: Produced by five smallholding farmers, from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Roasted at PT’s Coffee, where the motto is “without the love, it’s just coffee.” Visit www.ptscoffee.com or call 888-678-JAVA for more information.
Bottom_Line: A vibrant, harmonious Ecuador cup that leads with floral depth and richly sweet-tart fruit notes — lively and invigorating.

Review_Description: Brightly sweet, high-toned. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, red plum, maple syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; very silky, vibrant mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit.
Blind_Assessment: Brightly sweet, high-toned. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, red plum, maple syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; very silky, vibrant mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, entirely of the Ethiopian 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). HWC Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung, Taiwan. For more information, visit www.hwcroasters.com.
Bottom_Line: A lively, cocoa- and stone fruit-driven washed Ethiopia with a throughline of sweet citrus notes supported by rich aromatic wood.

Coffee_Name: Panama Boquete Casa Ruiz Finca Cafelandia Pacamara
Review_Description: Complex, sweetly herbaceous. Tamarind, cocoa nib, vanilla bean, freesia, lemon-thyme in aroma and cup. Savory-leaning structure with brisk acidity; viscous, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The crisp finish leads with notes of freesia and lemon-thyme.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, sweetly herbaceous. Tamarind, cocoa nib, vanilla bean, freesia, lemon-thyme in aroma and cup. Savory-leaning structure with brisk acidity; viscous, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The crisp finish leads with notes of freesia and lemon-thyme.
Notes: Produced at Casa Ruiz, entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Libero Coffee is a specialty coffee shop and roaster in Taipei. Visit www.facebook.com/LiberoCoffeeBar/?locale=zh_TW for more information.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered washed Panama Pacamara, sweetly savory and richly herbaceous with undertones of cocoa nib and tamarind.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Gediyo Yirgacheffe Gedeb Banko Gotiti G1 Natural
Review_Description: Crisp, fruit-toned, delicately floral. Baking chocolate, lime zest, date, narcissus, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; crisply satiny mouthfeel. Gently drying finish with aromatic wood notes supported by lime zest.
Blind_Assessment: Crisp, fruit-toned, delicately floral. Baking chocolate, lime zest, date, narcissus, fresh-cut fir in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; crisply satiny mouthfeel. Gently drying finish with aromatic wood notes supported by lime zest.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Libero Coffee is a specialty coffee shop and roaster in Taipei. Visit www.facebook.com/LiberoCoffeeBar/?locale=zh_TW for more information.
Bottom_Line: A quietly balanced, crisply chocolaty natural Ethiopia cup with rich aromatic wood notes throughout.

Review_Description: Crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned. Baking chocolate, cashew, orange zest, date, gardenia in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with gentle acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. The gently drying finish centers around bittersweet chocolate notes.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned. Baking chocolate, cashew, orange zest, date, gardenia in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with gentle acidity; crisp, lightly satiny mouthfeel. The gently drying finish centers around bittersweet chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced and roasted by Finca El Rey in Veracruz, Mexico. Certified USDA Organic. Founded in 1954 by Italian immigrants, Finca El Rey is still family-owned and operated by third-generation Reynaldo Bernardi. Visit soloalto.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A friendly, accessible Mexico cup: richly chocolaty and supported by sweet nut, fruit and floral tones.

Review_Description: Fruit-forward, intensely sweet. Watermelon candy, tangy kefir, salted plum, raw chocolate, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with sparkling acidity; plush, very syrupy mouthfeel. A long, complex finish fulfills the promise of the cup.

Bottom_Line: A uniquely composed experimentally processed Ecuador cup that’s a roller-coaster of aroma and flavor — an exhilarating ride.

Review_Description: Complex, multi-layered. Nectarine, freesia, hop flowers, agave syrup, basil in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with high-toned acidity; plush, viscous mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, multi-layered. Nectarine, freesia, hop flowers, agave syrup, basil in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with high-toned acidity; plush, viscous mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Macarena Farm entirely of the Tabi variety of Arabica. Processed by a complex double fermentation method, in which ​​the coffee fruit is first sterilized, then fermented anaerobically in the whole fruit in a bio-reactor with added microorganisms. After this fermentation in the whole fruit, the coffee is pulped and subjected to a second fermentation, after which the beans are sealed through the impact of hot and cold water before washing and careful drying by machine for 36 hours. JBC Coffee Roasters’ vision is simple: “let the coffee lead the way” through sourcing and roasting the best and most unique coffees available and rewarding the farmers who grow those coffees with substantial premiums. Visit www.jbccoffeeroasters.com or call 608-256-5282 for more information
Bottom_Line: An invigoratingly bright anaerobic Colombia grounded by rich savory impulses with compelling complications.

Blind_Assessment: Chocolaty, deeply rich. Dark chocolate, vanilla bean, yellow plum, cashew butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet with vibrant, juicy acidity; viscous, richly satiny mouthfeel. A long finish consolidates to notes of vanilla bean and cashew butter.

Review_Description: Sweet and lively. Tea rose, salted caramel, watermelon, fresh-cut fir, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory with brisk acidity; very full, satiny mouthfeel. Crisp finish with notes of tea rose and fresh-cut fir.

Bottom_Line: This Kenya hits all the notes: tart fruit, spicy florals, rich chocolate, pleasing aromatic wood and complex citrus.

Review_Description: Balanced, crisply sweet. Dark chocolate, pistachio, date, wisteria, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with gently bright acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. A sweet finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and pistachio.

Bottom_Line: A sweet, chocolaty washed Colombia cup, inviting in its familiarity and depth, with intriguing savory nut underpinnings (think pistachio).

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory, berry-toned. Raspberry, baking chocolate, almond, fir, sarsaparilla in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Gently drying wood-framed finish with chocolate undertones.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory, berry-toned. Raspberry, baking chocolate, almond, fir, sarsaparilla in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; very full, creamy mouthfeel. Gently drying wood-framed finish with chocolate undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of Proyecto Cabanas in the Southern part of Honduras bordering El Salvador, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole cherries are fermented in an oxygen-free environment before being dried in the whole fruit. True Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe in Wisconsin whose motto is, “On a never-ending quest to bring you a great cup of coffee, by staying true to the bean.” Visit www.truecoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A crisply berry-driven anaerobic natural Honduras, with pleasing almond and chocolate complications.

Review_Description: Floral, fruity, chocolaty. Blueberry, star jasmine, dark chocolate, hazelnut brittle, pomelo in aroma and cup. Deeply sweet structure with sparkling acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty and fruit-toned in the very long and satisfying finish.
Blind_Assessment: Floral, fruity, chocolaty. Blueberry, star jasmine, dark chocolate, hazelnut brittle, pomelo in aroma and cup. Deeply sweet structure with sparkling acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty and fruit-toned in the very long and satisfying finish.
Notes: Produced by Basha Bekele, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom_Line: At the center of this pretty natural-processed Ethiopia is a melange of bright stone fruit and rich spice-toned florals grounded by deep chocolate, a winning aromatic and flavor profile.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Luz Helena Salazar Wine Yeast Grape Honey
Review_Description: Sweetly spice-toned. Concord grape, ginger blossom, baking chocolate, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Gently vibrant structure with a fruity/juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish, supported by notes of lemon verbena and maple syrup.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly spice-toned. Concord grape, ginger blossom, baking chocolate, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Gently vibrant structure with a fruity/juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned finish, supported by notes of lemon verbena and maple syrup.
Notes: Produced by Luz Helena Salazar, entirely of the Castillo variety of Arabica, and fermented with wine yeasts before drying by the honey method (some fruit flesh is left on the beans during drying). GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected].
Bottom_Line: A Colombia Castillo experimentally fermented with wine yeasts— spice-toned and lively with an especially viscous mouthfeel.

Review_Description: Juicy, vibrant, fruit-forward. Mulberry, ginger blossom, cocoa nib, toffee, amber in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, flavor-laden finish that fulfills the promise of the cup.
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind_Assessment: Juicy, vibrant, fruit-forward. Mulberry, ginger blossom, cocoa nib, toffee, amber in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, flavor-laden finish that fulfills the promise of the cup.
Notes: Produced by JN Farms from trees of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a malolactic fermentation method designed by Miguel Meza, in which whole fruit is inoculated with both yeasts and malolactic bacteria, then fermented in anaerobic conditions for about a week before being dried in the whole fruit. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A juicy, fruity, floral-toned Ka‘ū  cup processed by malolactic fermentation, a technique commonly used in wine that results in a coffee with concentrated berry and spicy floral notes.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Diima Natural Process Benti Nenka, Hambela Wamena
Review_Description: Delicately sweet-tart, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, pineapple, narcissus, musk, cedar in aroma and cup. Intricately sweet structure with bright acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to cocoa nib, narcissus and cedar.
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Delicately sweet-tart, cocoa-toned. Cocoa nib, pineapple, narcissus, musk, cedar in aroma and cup. Intricately sweet structure with bright acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to cocoa nib, narcissus and cedar.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from trees of the Wolisho, Kurume, 74110 and 74112 varieties of Arabica and processed at the Benti Nenka Washing Station by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Review_Description: Richly sweet-savory. Tamarind, candycap mushroom, fresh-cut fir, grapefruit zest, freesia in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Gently drying finish centered around notes of tamarind and fresh-cut fir.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-savory. Tamarind, candycap mushroom, fresh-cut fir, grapefruit zest, freesia in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Gently drying finish centered around notes of tamarind and fresh-cut fir.
Notes: Produced by Claudia Samboni, entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Hub Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster focused on single-origin coffees, with several cafes in the Reno area. Visit www.hubcoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A savory-leaning Colombia cup with undertones of spicy florals and tangy tropical fruit.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet, roast-rounded. Date, orange zest, kola nut, lightly scorched cedar, vanilla bean in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with crisply bittersweet acidity; lightly velvety mouthfeel. Sweetly nut-toned finish with hints of vanilla.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet, roast-rounded. Date, orange zest, kola nut, lightly scorched cedar, vanilla bean in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with crisply bittersweet acidity; lightly velvety mouthfeel. Sweetly nut-toned finish with hints of vanilla.
Notes: Certified USDA Organic and fair trade. Producer not disclosed. Twiga Coffee is based in Sacramento, California. Ten percent of all sales are donated to organizations supporting conservation efforts. Visit www.twigacoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A friendly, crisply chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned Rwanda complicated by pleasingly bittersweet citrus zest.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca Paraiso Gesha Wilton Benitez
Review_Description: Delicately fruit-forward, complex, multi-layered. Bergamot, lychee, honeysuckle, lemon verbena, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bright, richly bittersweet structure with high-toned acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Integrated, flavor-laden finish.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately fruit-forward, complex, multi-layered. Bergamot, lychee, honeysuckle, lemon verbena, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bright, richly bittersweet structure with high-toned acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Integrated, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica. Processed by the kōji method, in which the coffee fruit is first sterilized and then fermented in a bio-reactor and inoculated with a selection of Japanese kōji (Aspergillus oryzae). This mold species breaks down starch into simple sugars and is commonly used in the production of soy sauce, miso, sake and shōchū. After whole-fruit fermentation, the coffee is pulped and subjected to a second fermentation phase. A bean-sealing process follows, carried out through impacts of hot and cold water, before the beans are dried by machine for 46 hours. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit modcup.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: Balanced, deep, elegant and inviting, this experimentally processed Geisha is characterized by tropical fruit, bittersweet citrus, and rich aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Brightly sweet, deeply floral. Star jasmine, apricot, almond, caramel, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright, juicy acidity; very appealing silky mouthfeel. Floral-and nut-toned finish.
Blind_Assessment: Brightly sweet, deeply floral. Star jasmine, apricot, almond, caramel, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright, juicy acidity; very appealing silky mouthfeel. Floral-and nut-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Duberney Cifuentes, entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit modcup.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A lovely floral-driven washed Geisha cup, with the flowers supported by richly sweet stone fruit and sweet herb.

Notes: Produced by Segundo Lasso of Finca La Esperanza, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method (dried with some of the fruit flesh or mucilage still on the bean). Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit shopee.tw/zengkaochen for more information.
Bottom_Line: A deep, rich-toned Colombia Pink Bourbon, chocolaty and balanced.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Antioquia El Roble Long Fermentation Washed Chiroso
Review_Description: Sweet, deeply resonant, chocolaty. Tea rose, black cherry, cashew, dark chocolate, a hint of marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with gentle, round acidity; syrupy, full mouthfeel. Cashew and tea rose carry into a long, floral-toned finish.

Review_Description: Brightly fruit-toned, gently tart. Dark chocolate, raspberry, narcissus, cedar, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Chocolaty, fruit-toned finish, with undertones of cedar.

Review_Description: Juicy, fruit-centered. Dried apricot, lychee, almond, cocoa nib, magnolia in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, vibrant acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Floral finish supported by dried apricot notes.

Blind_Assessment: High-toned, richly bright. Pomegranate, red currant, cane sugar, almond brittle, narcissus in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The crisply sweet finish leads with notes of pomegranate and almond.`
Notes: Produced at Teremuka Coffee Estate, from trees of the SL34, SL28 and  Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Notes: Produced at Teremuka Coffee Estate, from trees of the SL34, SL28 and  Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Review_Description: Brightly sweet, gently herbaceous. Lemongrass, praline, tangerine, oak, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with vibrant acidity; silky-smooth mouthfeel. The crisply sweet finish consolidates to lemongrass and agave syrup.

Bottom_Line: An invitingly herbaceous Ecuador cup with distinct notes of lemongrass and sweet ballast from praline and citrus.

Review_Description: Chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned. Dark chocolate, hazelnut butter, Bing cherry, cedar, red grape in aroma and cup. Sweet in structure with gentle balance; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with notes of dark chocolate and hazelnut with undertones of cherry.
Blind_Assessment: Chocolaty, sweetly nut-toned. Dark chocolate, hazelnut butter, Bing cherry, cedar, red grape in aroma and cup. Sweet in structure with gentle balance; creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with notes of dark chocolate and hazelnut with undertones of cherry.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers of Lima Coffees, from trees of the Catimor, Caturra, Bourbon and Typica varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Bottom_Line: Rich dark chocolate and sweet-tart stone fruit are equal impulses in this confident and deep-toned Peru.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet, deeply nut-toned. Red grape, pistachio, lemon verbena, cedar, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to red grape and pistachio.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet, deeply nut-toned. Red grape, pistachio, lemon verbena, cedar, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to red grape and pistachio.

Bottom_Line: This richly nutty, crisply chocolaty Guatemala cup is carried by its deft balance, both in the nose and in the cup.

Review_Description: Gently fruit-driven, spice-toned. Raspberry jam, white pepper, magnolia, cedar, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle, round acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of raspberry and cedar.
Blind_Assessment: Gently fruit-driven, spice-toned. Raspberry jam, white pepper, magnolia, cedar, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle, round acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of raspberry and cedar.
Notes: Produced smallholding farmers from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed at by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit) at Keramo Daye Bensa Station, owned by Asefa and Mulugeta Dukamo.
