Bottom_Line: A cleanly natural-processed Ethiopia cup, berry-centric and gently spice toned, shot through with sweet florals.

Review_Description: Crisply cocoa-toned, nut-driven. Cocoa powder, hazelnut butter, fresh-cut fir, raisin, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with pert acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The sweetly nutty finish is framed by notes of fresh-cut fir.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply cocoa-toned, nut-driven. Cocoa powder, hazelnut butter, fresh-cut fir, raisin, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with pert acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The sweetly nutty finish is framed by notes of fresh-cut fir.
Notes: Certified USDA Organic and Fair Trade. Processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Rusty Dog Coffee is a Madison, Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit www.rustydogcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A straight-ahead Peru cup with leading notes of cocoa powder and rich hazelnut, sweet and deep.

Review_Description: Delicately sweet-savory, spice-toned. Cocoa nib, tamarind, pistachio, black cherry, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Deep-toned structure with lively acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Crisply spice-toned finish supported by notes of tamarind and pistachio.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately sweet-savory, spice-toned. Cocoa nib, tamarind, pistachio, black cherry, pink peppercorn in aroma and cup. Deep-toned structure with lively acidity; plush, satiny mouthfeel. Crisply spice-toned finish supported by notes of tamarind and pistachio.
Notes: Produced by Sergio and Isabel Ticas, entirely of the Pacamara variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Roasted at PT’s Coffee, where the motto is “without the love, it’s just coffee.” Visit www.ptscoffee.com or call 888-678-JAVA for more information.
Bottom_Line: Subtly enticing, with an umami throughline characteristic of the Pacamara variety — rich and deep.

Coffee_Name: Colombia La Cristalina Pink Bourbon Natural
Review_Description: Sweetly spice-driven. Dried cranberry, freesia, fennel, almond, a hint of paprika in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; full, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of cranberry and fennel.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly spice-driven. Dried cranberry, freesia, fennel, almond, a hint of paprika in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; full, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of cranberry and fennel.
Notes: Produced by the Valdes family of Finca La Cristalina, entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Founded in 1994, Coffee By Design is a specialty coffee roaster in Portland, Maine that also operates three coffee shops in town, as well as one in Freeport. For more information, visit www.coffeebydesign.com.
Bottom_Line: An interestingly savory line — fennel, paprika — runs through this sweet Pink Bourbon cup, giving it intrigue and depth.

Review_Description: Savory-leaning, deep-toned. Artichoke blossom, salted caramel, lemon verbena, oak, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The savory finish centers around notes of artichoke blossom and salted caramel.
Blind_Assessment: Savory-leaning, deep-toned. Artichoke blossom, salted caramel, lemon verbena, oak, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with brisk acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The savory finish centers around notes of artichoke blossom and salted caramel.
Notes: Produced by members of the indigenous Inga community and processed by the honey method, in which the fruit skin is removed but some mucilage is left on the bean during drying. Founded in 1994, Coffee By Design is a specialty coffee roaster in Portland, Maine that also operates three coffee shops in town, as well as one in Freeport. For more information, visit www.coffeebydesign.com.
Bottom_Line: Sweet herb and perfumy musk notes complicate this intriguingly savory-toned honey-processed Colombia cup.

Review_Description: Umami-driven, uniquely composed. Green grape, nopales, cashew, elm, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Savory-tart structure with bittersweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Savory-toned finish with notes of nopales and elm.
Blind_Assessment: Umami-driven, uniquely composed. Green grape, nopales, cashew, elm, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Savory-tart structure with bittersweet acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Savory-toned finish with notes of nopales and elm.
Notes: Produced by Gasharu Coffee and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Founded in 1994, Coffee By Design is a specialty coffee roaster in Portland, Maine that also operates three coffee shops in town, as well as one in Freeport. For more information, visit www.coffeebydesign.com.
Bottom_Line: An anaerobic-processed coffee characterized by rich bittersweetness and gentle, grapey tartness.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca Juan Martin Aced Sidra
Review_Description: Intensely fruit- and floral-toned. Passionfruit, star jasmine, pink grapefruit zest, amber, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with balanced, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Blind_Assessment: Intensely fruit- and floral-toned. Passionfruit, star jasmine, pink grapefruit zest, amber, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with balanced, juicy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Resonant, lingering, flavor-saturated finish.
Notes: Produced by Juan Martin, entirely of the Sidra variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Revel Coffee is a micro-roaster located in Billings, Montana. Its motto: “Quality is paramount – a difference you can revel in.” Visit www.revelcoffee.com or call 406-534-9621 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A gorgeous presentation of the rare and admired Sidra variety — natural-processed to amplify fruit and florals — juicy, bright, balanced.

Coffee_Name: Guatemala Natural Santa Felisa Gesha SF-04 95
Review_Description: Balanced, bright, sweetly tart. Dried Concord grape, candied walnut, myrrh, cocoa nib, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; crisp, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, bright, sweetly tart. Dried Concord grape, candied walnut, myrrh, cocoa nib, tangerine zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; crisp, viscous mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Agrocomercial Santa Felisa, S.A., entirely of the Gesha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A subtly complex, rich-toned anaerobic natural Guatemala cup, elegantly fruit-forward, balanced and juicy.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-forward, berry-driven. Mulberry jam, cocoa nib, lemon balm, agave syrup, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-tart structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish consolidates to notes of mulberry and lemon balm.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately fruit-forward, berry-driven. Mulberry jam, cocoa nib, lemon balm, agave syrup, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-tart structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish consolidates to notes of mulberry and lemon balm.
Notes: Produced by the Renancer Project from trees of the Caturra, Castillo and Colombia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying) with a double ferment step. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A quietly fruit-driven washed Colombia with mulberry and lemon throughlines and ballast from cocoa nib, all complicated by a hint of sweet ferment.

Review_Description: Richly sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, nectarine, almond butter, cocoa nib, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Focused, juicy finish centers around notes of bergamot and cocoa nib.
Origin: Jimma Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet, spice-toned. Bergamot, nectarine, almond butter, cocoa nib, star jasmine in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gently bright acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Focused, juicy finish centers around notes of bergamot and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers entirely of the 74110 variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Kakalove Café is a nano-roaster located in the small city of Chia-Yi in Taiwan that strives to procure and roast the finest quality coffee. Visit www.kakalovecafe.com.tw or email [email protected] for more information.
Bottom_Line: A classic washed Ethiopia cup with notes of stone fruit, cocoa nib, and distinct florals — harmonious and deep.

Review_Description: Richly floral, deeply aromatic. Narcissus, raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of narcissus and raspberry and undertones of cocoa nib.
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Richly floral, deeply aromatic. Narcissus, raspberry, cocoa nib, thyme, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of narcissus and raspberry and undertones of cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers, from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed process (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered, brightly sweet washed Ethiopia cup with deep floral and high-toned berry notes.

Review_Description: Deep-toned, richly bittersweet. Baking chocolate, pipe tobacco, date, gently scorched mesquite, gardenia in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with notes of pipe tobacco and gardenia.
Blind_Assessment: Deep-toned, richly bittersweet. Baking chocolate, pipe tobacco, date, gently scorched mesquite, gardenia in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with notes of pipe tobacco and gardenia.
Notes: A blend of seasonally rotating coffees, currently Guatemala and Mexico. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A deftly darker-roasted blend that’s enticingly smoky-deep, richly chocolaty and gently floral — especially nice with a splash of whole milk.

Review_Description: Balanced, crisply sweet-savory. Tangerine zest, narcissus, marjoram, shitake mushroom, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with quiet acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish supported by notes of cocoa nib and marjoram.
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, crisply sweet-savory. Tangerine zest, narcissus, marjoram, shitake mushroom, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with quiet acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Floral-toned finish supported by notes of cocoa nib and marjoram.
Notes: Produced at Teofahza Farm entirely of the SL34 variety of Arabica, and processed by the honey method, in which some of the fruit flesh is left on the beans during drying.  HWC Roasters is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taichung, Taiwan. For more information, visit www.hwcroasters.com.
Bottom_Line: A multi-layered, crisply sweet-savory honey-processed Alishan cup with cocoa nib and sweet herb notes as throughlines.

Coffee_Name: Galaxy Gesha Quindio Colombia Edwin Noreña
Review_Description: Soaringly high-toned anaerobic, bright, complex, exhilarating. Raspberry, rose, violet, cardamom, passionfruit in aroma and cup. In structure, layered and intriguingly savory-bright. Silky in mouthfeel, nimble and lively on the palate. Flowers carry far into a deep, long finish.
Blind_Assessment: Soaringly high-toned anaerobic, bright, complex, exhilarating. Raspberry, rose, violet, cardamom, passionfruit in aroma and cup. In structure, layered and intriguingly savory-bright. Silky in mouthfeel, nimble and lively on the palate. Flowers carry far into a deep, long finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Noreña of Finca Campo Hermoso entirely of the Gesha/Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a particularly elaborate anaerobic processing method. The whole coffee fruit is sealed in drums for CO2 fermentation for 72 hours, after which the skin and pulp are removed from the beans. The skin and pulp are infused with Galaxy hops and recombined with the pulped beans in the carbonic fermentation tanks for another 96 hours before the beans are sun-dried on raised beds. Barrington Coffee is an artisan roaster dedicated to elite coffees, fresh delivery and roasting that foregrounds the coffee and not the roast. Visit www.barringtoncoffee.com or call 800-528-0998 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A ringing giant of a coffee with vast, layered aromatics and a structure both bright and deep.

Review_Description: Floral and spice grandeur in a balanced anaerobic. Big, sweet, soaring, perfumy/spicy. Coriander, loquat, marjoram, cocoa, and a range of intense, spicy flowers in aroma and cup. Quite sweet but brightly tangy in structure, with a hint of savory depth. Creamy, lively mouthfeel. The finish is resonant, balanced and lasting.
Origin: Ka‘ū growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind_Assessment: Floral and spice grandeur in a balanced anaerobic. Big, sweet, soaring, perfumy/spicy. Coriander, loquat, marjoram, cocoa, and a range of intense, spicy flowers in aroma and cup. Quite sweet but brightly tangy in structure, with a hint of savory depth. Creamy, lively mouthfeel. The finish is resonant, balanced and lasting.
Notes: Produced by JN Farms from trees of the Red Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a malolactic fermentation method designed by Miguel Meza, in which whole fruit is inoculated with both yeasts and malolactic bacteria, then fermented in anaerobic conditions for about a week before fruit and pulp are removed and the beans are dried in the fruit flesh or mucilage. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom_Line: Sweet spice and flowers star in a high-toned symphonic cup, bright, layered, cocoa-anchored

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca El Paraiso Rose Tea
Review_Description: Subtly intense anaerobic flower bomb. Sweetly tangy, very brightly floral. Rose, yogurt, blood orange, peach, cashew butter in aroma and cup. Juicy and sweet-tart in structure; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Flowers lead in a balanced finish.
Blind_Assessment: Subtly intense anaerobic flower bomb. Sweetly tangy, very brightly floral. Rose, yogurt, blood orange, peach, cashew butter in aroma and cup. Juicy and sweet-tart in structure; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Flowers lead in a balanced finish.
Notes: Produced by Diego Samuel Bermudez Tapia of El Paraiso Farm from trees of the Castillo, Colombia and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the double-anaerobic method: Whole fruit is fermented in hermetically sealed tanks for 24 hours before the skins are removed. The fruit flesh or mucilage is left on the bean for another 36-hour sealed-tank fermentation. Finally, the coffee is dried on raised beds with the mucilage still on the bean, as in the honey method. GK Coffee is a nano-roastery in Yilan, Taiwan that offers both retail and wholesale coffee. For more information, visit www.gkcoffee.com.tw or email [email protected].
Bottom_Line: An original yet balanced anaerobic profile: Bright rose-like flowers are enveloped in a plushly juicy, peach-yogurt-like matrix.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Monteblanco Rodrigo Sanchez Carbonic Maceration
Review_Description: Subtly suave, brightly juicy anaerobic. Rose, strawberry, cocoa, pink lemonade, yogurt in aroma and cup. A juicy floral acidity dominates in structure, deepened by a hint of savory depth. Lightly silky, lively mouthfeel. Strawberry and cocoa give way to flowers in a drying finish.
Blind_Assessment: Subtly suave, brightly juicy anaerobic. Rose, strawberry, cocoa, pink lemonade, yogurt in aroma and cup. A juicy floral acidity dominates in structure, deepened by a hint of savory depth. Lightly silky, lively mouthfeel. Strawberry and cocoa give way to flowers in a drying finish.
Notes: Produced by Rodrigo Sanchez of Finca Monteblanco from trees of the Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by a carbonic maceration method involving two fermentation phases in closed tanks injected with CO2. The first fermentation involves the whole coffee fruit, after which the skins and pulp are removed and the beans are fermented a second time with their skins and juice, after which they are washed and dried. Klatch Coffee is an award-winning small-batch roasting company in the Los Angeles area whose resident barista and trainer, Heather Perry, won both the 2003 and 2007 United States Barista Championships brewing a Klatch Coffee espresso blend. Visit www.klatchroasting.com or call 877-455-2824 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A light-footed and balanced anaerobic cup, floral without perfumy excess, cleanly fruit-toned and silky in texture.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Cauca Granja Paraiso 92 – Pink Bourbon
Review_Description: Exuberant yet coherent anaerobic. Butterscotch, blueberry, cocoa, lilac, candycap mushroom in aroma and cup. Sweet, tart and savory impulses balance in a richly expressive structure. Plush, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit notes consolidate in a long though quiet finish.
Blind_Assessment: Exuberant yet coherent anaerobic. Butterscotch, blueberry, cocoa, lilac, candycap mushroom in aroma and cup. Sweet, tart and savory impulses balance in a richly expressive structure. Plush, lightly syrupy mouthfeel. Fruit notes consolidate in a long though quiet finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Finca El Paraíso entirely of the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of brewer’s yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Reprise Coffee is a quality-oriented small-batch roaster and café located in Lake Forest, Illinois, north of Chicago. Visit reprisecoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A fruit-forward but balanced, tangy-rich rendition of the anaerobic style.

Review_Description: : Anaerobic intrigue, gracefully balanced. Delicately tangy/tart, sweetly herb- and cocoa-toned. Clove, cocoa, tangerine zest, honey, orchid in aroma and cup. Lightly juicy and sweetly tart in structure; satiny in mouthfeel. The finish is cocoa-centered yet deeply and subtly nuanced.
Blind_Assessment: : Anaerobic intrigue, gracefully balanced. Delicately tangy/tart, sweetly herb- and cocoa-toned. Clove, cocoa, tangerine zest, honey, orchid in aroma and cup. Lightly juicy and sweetly tart in structure; satiny in mouthfeel. The finish is cocoa-centered yet deeply and subtly nuanced.
Notes: Produced at Gatta Farm from traditional Ethiopia varieties of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole fruit is fermented in tanks with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. Olympia Coffee Roasting is a small-batch wholesale and retail roasting company with a youthful, no-nonsense style and a commitment to high-quality organic coffees. Visit www.olympiacoffee.com or call 360-753-0066 for more information.
Bottom_Line: Impressive in its delicate completeness and balance. For those interested in exploring the deeply expressive yet subtler side of the anaerobic style.

Review_Description: Big, round, very sweet anaerobic, intensely floral. Lilac, lavender, strawberry yogurt, roasted macadamia, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Candy-like sweetness dominates in the structure, balanced by lactic tang and a savory bottom. Buoyantly syrupy mouthfeel. Complex flowers and nut notes dominate in a continuing sweet but savory-edged finish.
Blind_Assessment: Big, round, very sweet anaerobic, intensely floral. Lilac, lavender, strawberry yogurt, roasted macadamia, a hint of musk in aroma and cup. Candy-like sweetness dominates in the structure, balanced by lactic tang and a savory bottom. Buoyantly syrupy mouthfeel. Complex flowers and nut notes dominate in a continuing sweet but savory-edged finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez of Finca El Paraíso entirely of the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed by a complexly detailed version of the double-anaerobic method (sealed-tank fermentation of the whole fruit with the addition of brewer’s yeast, removal of skin and pulp, and a second fermentation of the beans shut in the tank with the removed skin and pulp). Additional processing nuance includes a thermal shock wash (soaking the whole fruit in hot water for 30 seconds, then cold water for 30 seconds) to reduce astringency. Prism Coffee Works is a specialty roaster, cafe and barista training center based in Seoul, South Korea. Visit www.instagram.com/prismcoffeeworks for more information.
Bottom_Line: A delightful flower bomb of a coffee, with a savory nut-like edge and an inherent balance that saves it from sentimentality.

Review_Description: An almost sugary-sweet, explosively herby and floral anaerobic. Rosemary, pink peppercorn, star jasmine, apricot yogurt, stone fruit in aroma and cup. Very sweet in structure with a tart edge; plush, supple mouthfeel. Yogurt and herb dominate the sweet finish.
Blind_Assessment: An almost sugary-sweet, explosively herby and floral anaerobic. Rosemary, pink peppercorn, star jasmine, apricot yogurt, stone fruit in aroma and cup. Very sweet in structure with a tart edge; plush, supple mouthfeel. Yogurt and herb dominate the sweet finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilder Lazo of Finca Bella Alejandria entirely of the Gesha/Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by a version of the honey or semi-washed anaerobic method: after the removal of the fruit skin and pulp, but with the flesh or mucilage still on the bean, the coffee is fermented in hermetically sealed tanks for 200 hours. After fermentation, the coffee is sun-dried for 18 days mixed with mandarin orange peels before being rested for 25 days, then milled. Founded in Savannah Georgia, PERC Coffee Roasters has a total of three cafes in Savannah and Atlanta, as well as a coffee education and training center. Visit www.perccoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: Original and complex in its herb and flowers; almost disconcertingly sweet, with just an edge of yogurty tang.

Review_Description: Intense, eccentric anaerobic candy-bomb. Very sweet, intensely fruity and spicy. Bubblegum, musk, raspberry, pistachio, ginger in aroma and cup. Profoundly sweet in structure with a touch of delicately tart acidity. Velvety, lively mouthfeel. In the finish candyish notes fade and musky flowers come forward.
Blind_Assessment: Intense, eccentric anaerobic candy-bomb. Very sweet, intensely fruity and spicy. Bubblegum, musk, raspberry, pistachio, ginger in aroma and cup. Profoundly sweet in structure with a touch of delicately tart acidity. Velvety, lively mouthfeel. In the finish candyish notes fade and musky flowers come forward.
Notes: Produced by Sebastián Ramirez of Finca El Placer entirely of the Caturra variety of Arabica, and processed by a proprietary anaerobic method, in which 95% ripe and 5% semi-ripe cherries undergo two phases of fermentation. First, the coffee is fermented in the whole cherry in sealed 200-liter tanks for 120 hours at 18 degrees Celsius, with microorganisms present. Then, skins and pulp are removed, leaving some of the fruit flesh on the beans, which are fermented anaerobically for 72 hours with the addition of CO2. The coffee is then slow-dried for 15 days. Chromatic Coffee prides itself in doing everything in-house and meticulously, from printing its attractive bags to modifying equipment to sourcing and roasting its fine coffees. Visit www.chromaticcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A candy-like sweetness is complicated by a lavish, unpredictable display of eccentric aromatic notes, from bubblegum to ginger to musk.

Review_Description: Exceptionally sweet, very lactic and yogurty, strikingly original in aromatics. Candied violet, clove, rose yogurt, lavender, frankincense in aroma and cup. Sweet and complexly layered in structure. Syrupy mouthfeel. Richly sweet in the finish.
Blind_Assessment: Exceptionally sweet, very lactic and yogurty, strikingly original in aromatics. Candied violet, clove, rose yogurt, lavender, frankincense in aroma and cup. Sweet and complexly layered in structure. Syrupy mouthfeel. Richly sweet in the finish.
Notes: Produced by Jairo Arcila of Finca Santa Monica, and processed by a controversial variation of the anaerobic method: fermented in the whole fruit in sealed tanks for 72 hours with the addition of peach pulp and wine yeasts, then pulped and dried on raised beds with peach pieces scattered among the beans. Royal Flamingo is a Columbus, Ohio-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit www.royalflamingocoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A particularly sweet anaerobic, with a distinct lactic tang and a surprising, unusual range of aromatics.

Review_Description: Elegantly fruit-toned, tropical. Lychee, passionfruit, bergamot, star jasmine, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very rich, buoyantly creamy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, integrated finish.
Blind_Assessment: Elegantly fruit-toned, tropical. Lychee, passionfruit, bergamot, star jasmine, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Gently bright, sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very rich, buoyantly creamy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, integrated finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez entirely of the Papayo variety of Arabica. Processed by the kōji method, in which the coffee fruit is first sterilized and then fermented in a bio-reactor and inoculated with a selection of Japanese kōji (Aspergillus oryzae). This mold species breaks down starch into simple sugars and is commonly used in the production of soy sauce, miso, sake and shōchū. After whole-fruit fermentation, the coffee is pulped and subjected to a second fermentation phase. A bean-sealing process follows, carried out through impacts of hot and cold water, before the beans are dried by machine for 46 hours at 38C (100F). Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A uniquely composed cup from a rare variety of Arabica (Papayo), meticulously processed using complex methods by Wilton Benitez, widely recognized for his innovative processing experiments.

Review_Description: Delicately fruit-toned, richly sweet-tart. Raspberry, magnolia, baking chocolate, honey, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; viscous, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The quiet finish centers around raspberry and crisp chocolate notes.
Blind_Assessment: Delicately fruit-toned, richly sweet-tart. Raspberry, magnolia, baking chocolate, honey, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; viscous, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The quiet finish centers around raspberry and crisp chocolate notes.
Notes: Produced at Aquíares Estate entirely of the Centroamericano variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). David's Nose is a specialty coffee roaster based in Taipei, Taiwan whose founder studied agronomy and has a deep interest in crop quality. For more information, visit www.dnose.com.tw.
Bottom_Line: An accessibly complex natural-processed Costa Rica that leads with distinct berry notes with undertones of crisp chocolate and sweet herbs.

Review_Description: Cleanly fruit-toned, crisply chocolaty. Date, pomegranate, cocoa nib, maple syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with high-toned, balanced acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Cleanly fruit-toned, crisply chocolaty. Date, pomegranate, cocoa nib, maple syrup, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with high-toned, balanced acidity; viscous, syrupy mouthfeel. Long, resonant, flavor-laden finish.
Notes: Produced by Dinkalem Ademe entirely of the Wush Wush variety of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Established in 2010, Red Rooster is an organic-certified micro-roaster focusing on socially conscious, high-quality coffee. Visit redroostercoffee.com or call 540-745-7338 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A rare single-farmer Ethiopia and a rare variety of Arabica, this natural-processed Wush Wush is super-clean, deep-toned, and richly sweet.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory, gently lactic. Strawberry yogurt, lemon verbena, baking chocolate, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with tangy acidity; soft, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, fruit- and cocoa-toned finish.
Origin: Chiriqui, Boquete growing region, western Panama
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-savory, gently lactic. Strawberry yogurt, lemon verbena, baking chocolate, hazelnut, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-savory structure with tangy acidity; soft, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, fruit- and cocoa-toned finish.
Notes: Produced by Edwin Rosas of Finca Lorayne entirely of the Catuaí variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic natural method, in which coffee in the whole fruit is fermented in an oxygen-free environment before being dried, also in the whole fruit. Ragamuffin Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster based in Newbury Park, California. Visit www.ragamuffinroasters.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A pretty Panama Catuaí that expresses the classic tanginess of the anaerobic natural profile with delicacy and balance.

Review_Description: Wildly tropical, fruity and deep. Passion fruit, mango, tamarind, rice candy, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; plushly syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, fruity finish.
Blind_Assessment: Wildly tropical, fruity and deep. Passion fruit, mango, tamarind, rice candy, hop flowers in aroma and cup. Richly bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; plushly syrupy mouthfeel. Long, lingering, fruity finish.
Notes: Produced by Wilton Benitez entirely of the Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica and processed by a proprietary anaerobic fermentation method in which ​​the coffee fruit is first sterilized, then fermented anaerobically in the whole fruit with added microorganisms for 36 hours. After this fermentation in the whole fruit, the coffee is subjected to thermal shock (first a high temperature to swell the beans and allow the unique flavors and aromas from the initial anaerobic yeast fermentation to penetrate the seeds, then a cold temperature to constrict the beans and lock in those flavors and aromas). Finally, the whole cherries are carefully dried by machine until the beans reach 10.5% internal humidity. Founded in 2013, modcup coffee focuses on fresh roasting and distinctive natural-processed coffees. Visit modcup.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: An unabashed fruit bomb of a coffee: produced entirely from the rare Pink Bourbon variety of Arabica, and processed anaerobically, netting an intense, flavor-saturated, richly aromatic profile with ballast from bittersweet floral notes.

Coffee_Name: Kenya Kiambu Mandela Estate AA Washed Process
Review_Description: Complex, nuanced, multi-layered. Black currant, freesia, amber, toffee, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with black currant and toffee notes in the short, rounding to amber and cedar in the long.
Blind_Assessment: Complex, nuanced, multi-layered. Black currant, freesia, amber, toffee, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, high-toned acidity; syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The resonant finish leads with black currant and toffee notes in the short, rounding to amber and cedar in the long.
Notes: Produced by the Kariruki family from trees of the classic Kenya SL28 and SL34 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A distinctive Kenya cup laden with classic black currant notes and undertones of spicy florals — especially vibrant acidity.

Coffee_Name: Costa Rica Volcán Azul Geisha Yeast-Washed
Review_Description: Richly sweet-tart, fruit-toned. Concord grape, dark chocolate, star anise, sandalwood, pineapple saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with tart-savory acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned Concord grape takes center stage in the finish, supported by star anise and dark chocolate.
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-tart, fruit-toned. Concord grape, dark chocolate, star anise, sandalwood, pineapple saltwater taffy in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with tart-savory acidity; full, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. Cocoa-toned Concord grape takes center stage in the finish, supported by star anise and dark chocolate.
Notes: Produced by Alejo Castro of Volcán Azul entirely of the Geisha variety of Arabica, and processed by the anaerobic washed method, in which the de-pulped coffee fruit is fermented with limited oxygen, in this case with the addition of wine yeasts, before washing and drying. Kafe Coffee Roastery is a specialty roaster based in Zhubei, Taiwan. Visit shopee.tw/zengkaochen for more information.
Bottom_Line: An aromatically exciting washed anaerobic Costa Rica Geisha saturated with high-toned fruit, deep chocolate, and rich spice tones.

Review_Description: Gently sweet-tart, floral-toned. Pomegranate, wisteria, pistachio, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-tart structure with delicately bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The tart-leaning finish leads with notes of pomegranate and lime zest, with undertones of oak and pistachio.
Blind_Assessment: Gently sweet-tart, floral-toned. Pomegranate, wisteria, pistachio, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Crisply sweet-tart structure with delicately bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The tart-leaning finish leads with notes of pomegranate and lime zest, with undertones of oak and pistachio.
Notes: Produced by members of the Adame Garbota Cooperative and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Caoban Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Taipei. Visit www.facebook.com/CAOBANCOFFEE for more information.
Bottom_Line: A juicy, bright natural-processed Ethiopia cup — invitingly tart, balanced by sweet floral and aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Sweetly fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine zest, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of lychee and tangerine zest with cocoa undertones.
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly fruit-forward, richly aromatic. Lychee, tangerine zest, cocoa nib, lemon verbena, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with bright acidity; satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of lychee and tangerine zest with cocoa undertones.
Notes: Yirgacheffe is a coffee region in southern Ethiopia that produces distinctive coffees from traditional selections of landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp are removed before drying).  Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A complex, balanced washed Ethiopia cup with cocoa-toned tropical fruit and sweet herb suggestions.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Banko Gotiti  G1 Natural
Review_Description: Balanced, crisply fruit-toned. Black cherry, pink grapefruit zest, almond, agave syrup, lilac in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Delicately fruit-toned finish with undertones of almond.
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, crisply fruit-toned. Black cherry, pink grapefruit zest, almond, agave syrup, lilac in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; full, syrupy mouthfeel. Delicately fruit-toned finish with undertones of almond.
Notes: Produced by smallholding-farmer members of Banko Gotiti Cooperative in the district of Gedeb, Ethiopia, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region. Processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Caoban Coffee is a specialty roaster and cafe based in Taipei. Visit www.facebook.com/CAOBANCOFFEE for more information.
Bottom_Line: A delicate, balanced natural-processed Ethiopia cup, fruit-forward and nutty with floral undertones.

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Guji Bule Hora Blue Nile Natural
Review_Description: Balanced, delicate, fruit-toned. Lily, baking chocolate, dried blueberry, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with cedar undertones.
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Balanced, delicate, fruit-toned. Lily, baking chocolate, dried blueberry, cedar, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned with brisk acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Fruit-toned finish with cedar undertones.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A natural-processed Ethiopia characterized by pleasing aromatic wood notes with support from ripe berry and crisp chocolate.

Review_Description: Crisply chocolaty, roast-rounded. Baking chocolate, gently scorched fir, salted caramel, date, orange zest in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of salted caramel.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply chocolaty, roast-rounded. Baking chocolate, gently scorched fir, salted caramel, date, orange zest in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with gentle, round acidity; velvety mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with undertones of salted caramel.
Notes: A blend comprised of two green coffees, a washed-process Rwanda and a natural-processed Ethiopia. Philipsburg Coffee Roasters is a specialty roaster based in Montana’s Flint Creek Valley that focuses on four or five seasonally rotating coffees at a time. Visit philipsburgcoffeeroasters.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: A medium-dark roasted Rwanda/Ethiopia blend driven by notes of date and crisp chocolate with a hint of roastiness.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-tart, richly nut-toned. Black cherry, cocoa nib, hazelnut, lime zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with gently bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The flavor-saturated finish centers around sweet nut and chocolate tones.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart, richly nut-toned. Black cherry, cocoa nib, hazelnut, lime zest, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with gently bright, balanced acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The flavor-saturated finish centers around sweet nut and chocolate tones.
Notes: Produced by ELLA —Women Producers of Guatemala — from trees of the Catuai, Bourbon and Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom_Line: A bright, balanced, women-farmed Guatemala cup driven by dark stone fruit, crisp chocolate, and deeply sweet hazelnut notes.

Review_Description: Richly floral, subtly complex. Star jasmine, cocoa nib, apricot, almond butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with floral acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The resonant finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and almond butter.
Origin: Gedeb District, Gedeo Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Richly floral, subtly complex. Star jasmine, cocoa nib, apricot, almond butter, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with floral acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The resonant finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and almond butter.
Notes: Produced by smallholding-farmer members Banko Gotiti Cooperative located in the village of Banko Gotiti in the southern district of Gedeb, Ethiopia, from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.

Review_Description: Sweetly citrusy, floral-toned. Violet, pink grapefruit, baking chocolate, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit and fresh-cut fir.
Origin: Hambela Wamena, Guji Zone, Oromia Region, Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Sweetly citrusy, floral-toned. Violet, pink grapefruit, baking chocolate, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of pink grapefruit and fresh-cut fir.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers surrounding METAD's Hambela Estate from selections of indigenous landrace varieties of Arabica long grown in the region, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom_Line: A friendly washed-process Ethiopia cup with gently sweet notes of citrus and delicate flowers throughout, supported by rich aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-tart. Pomegranate, freesia, cashew butter, oak, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish that leads with notes of cashew butter and oak.
Blind_Assessment: Crisply sweet-tart. Pomegranate, freesia, cashew butter, oak, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. Gently drying finish that leads with notes of cashew butter and oak.
Notes: Produced by Don Arcenio Castillo from trees of the Caturra and Bourbon varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (fruit skin and pulp removed before drying). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.
Bottom_Line: A brightly sweet, tart Guatemala profile with ballast from rich nut and aromatic wood notes.

Review_Description: Crisp, sweetly nut-toned. Hazelnut, caramel, roasted pear, balsam, lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of hazelnut and caramel, with undertones of balsam.
Blind_Assessment: Crisp, sweetly nut-toned. Hazelnut, caramel, roasted pear, balsam, lemon zest in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with gentle acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. The gently drying finish leads with notes of hazelnut and caramel, with undertones of balsam.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of Cooperativa El Porvenir from trees of the Bourbon, Caturra and Yellow Catuaí varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Old World Coffee Lab is a specialty coffee roaster with cafes in Reno and Carson City, Nevada. Visit www.oldworldcoffee.co for more information.

Review_Description: Richly sweet-savory, spice-toned. Dried fig, pistachio, allspice, narcissus, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet-savory structure with juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of salted caramel and allspice.
Origin: Mathira West District, Nyeri growing region, Kenya
Blind_Assessment: Richly sweet-savory, spice-toned. Dried fig, pistachio, allspice, narcissus, salted caramel in aroma and cup. Vibrantly sweet-savory structure with juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates to notes of salted caramel and allspice.
Notes: Produced by smallholding members of the Gikanda Farmers Cooperative Society from trees of the SL28, SL34 and Ruiru 11 varieties of Arabica, and processed by the washed method at the Gichathaini Factory. Visit www.templecoffee.com or call 916-454-1282 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A complex, multi-layered Kenya cup with a trifecta of sweet, spice-toned and umami impulses.

Coffee_Name: Guatemala Retiro del Quisaya Natural Process
Review_Description: Berry-driven, brightly sweet-tart. Berry melange, cocoa nib, amber, cedar, a hint of sassafras in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish centers around cocoa nib and raspberry notes.
Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala
Blind_Assessment: Berry-driven, brightly sweet-tart. Berry melange, cocoa nib, amber, cedar, a hint of sassafras in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The long, resonant finish centers around cocoa nib and raspberry notes.
Notes: Produced by Juan Luis Barrios Ortega of Finca Retiro del Quisaya from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Located in southwestern Colorado, Durango Coffee lays claim to a rich coffee history that dates to 1986. Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit www.durangocoffee.com or call 800-748-2275 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A fruit-forward natural-processed Guatemala cup complicated by resiny amber-like notes and a rich cocoa throughline.

Review_Description: Elegantly fruit-toned, lactic-leaning. Mulberry, pineapple yogurt, cocoa nib, hop flowers, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with bright, winy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp finish with notes of pineapple yogurt and sandalwood.
Blind_Assessment: Elegantly fruit-toned, lactic-leaning. Mulberry, pineapple yogurt, cocoa nib, hop flowers, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Bittersweet structure with bright, winy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp finish with notes of pineapple yogurt and sandalwood.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers from local heirloom varieties long grown in the region, and processed by the Yonis family at the Gara Agena Washing Station by the anaerobic natural method, in which whole coffee fruit is fermented with limited oxygen before drying, also in the whole fruit. RamsHead Coffee Roasters is a family-owned company founded by Bozeman, Montana natives Caleb and Laura Walker that specializes in direct trade microlot coffees. For more information, visit www.ramsheadcoffee.com.
Bottom_Line: An unabashedly fruit-forward anaerobic natural Ethiopia with the tangy, yogurt-like aromatics and flavor that often result from anaerobic fermentation; dark berry fruit, cocoa nib and bittersweet florals round out the profile.

Review_Description: Deeply sweet, richly savory. Dark chocolate, apricot, lilac, almond, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with juicy acidity; full, satiny-smooth mouthfeel. The sweet finish consolidates to notes of dark chocolate and almond butter.

Notes: Produced by Geiner Montano of Finca La Esperanza from trees of the Colombia and Castillo varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (skin and fruit flesh are removed before drying). Temple Coffee is a quality-focused retail and wholesale specialty roaster active in Sacramento, California since 2005. Committed to sourcing, roasting and brewing the finest coffees, Temple features coffee from distinguished single estates and cooperatives around the world. Coffee_Name: Guatemala Retiro del Quisaya Washed Process
Review_Description: Richly sweet, nut- and spice-toned. Macadamia nut, caramel, nutmeg, baking chocolate, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with balanced, bright acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. Quietly confident, caramelly and nutty finish.
Origin: San Martin Jilotepeque, Chimaltenango Department, Guatemala

Notes: Produced by Juan Luis Barrios Ortega of Finca Retiro del Quisaya from trees of the Bourbon, Typica and Pache varieties of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method (skin and fruit pulp removed before washing). Its motto is “Tough Town, Great Coffee.” Visit www.durangocoffee.com or call 800-748-2275 for more information.

Review_Description: Brightly sweet-tart. Lime zest, baking chocolate, agave syrup, freesia, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and marjoram.
Blind_Assessment: Brightly sweet-tart. Lime zest, baking chocolate, agave syrup, freesia, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. The quiet finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and marjoram.
Notes: Produced by smallholding farmers in the Kindeng and Arufa municipalities and processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Rusty Dog Coffee is a Madison, Wisconsin-based specialty coffee roaster. Visit www.rustydogcoffee.com for more information.
Bottom_Line: An invitingly tart-leaning natural-processed Papua New Guinea with suggestions of bright citrus and crisp chocolate throughout.

Review_Description: Cocoa-toned, delicately sweet-tart. Cocoa nib, almond nougat, Cara Cara orange, magnolia, lemon thyme in aroma and small cup. Gently bright structure with juicy-sweet acidity; full, vibrant mouthfeel. Cocoa- and citrus-toned finish.
Origin: Ka‘u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i
Blind_Assessment: Cocoa-toned, delicately sweet-tart. Cocoa nib, almond nougat, Cara Cara orange, magnolia, lemon thyme in aroma and small cup. Gently bright structure with juicy-sweet acidity; full, vibrant mouthfeel. Cocoa- and citrus-toned finish.
Notes: Produced at Miranda Farms entirely of the Red Catuai variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method. Paradise prides itself on quality and freshness, craft-roasting coffees in small batches only after orders are placed. Visit www.paradiseroasters.com or call 763-433-0626 for more information.
Bottom_Line: A subtly complex, quietly confident Ka‘ū cup with equal impulses toward cocoa and sweet citrus.

Review_Description: Complex, multi-layered. Cocoa nib, Meyer lemon marmalade, magnolia, hazelnut, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very satiny, smooth mouthfeel. Crisp finish that leads with notes of Meyer lemon and cocoa nib.
Origin: Odo Shakiso District, Guji Zone, southern Ethiopia
Blind_Assessment: Complex, multi-layered. Cocoa nib, Meyer lemon marmalade, magnolia, hazelnut, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with high-toned acidity; very satiny, smooth mouthfeel. Crisp finish that leads with notes of Meyer lemon and cocoa nib.
Notes: Produced by the Hassen family at their estate farm in the Guji Zone of southern Ethiopia from distinctive landrace selections of Arabica long grown in the region. This is a dry-processed or “natural” version, meaning the beans were dried inside the fruit rather than after the fruit has been removed, as is the case with wet-processed or “washed” coffees. Certified USDA organic. Founded in 1990, Roadmap CoffeeWorks, formerly Lexington Coffee Roasters, is an award-winning artisan roasting company based in Lexington, Virginia. Roadmap CoffeeWorks focuses on producing fresh, distinctive and sustainable coffees. Visit www.roadmapcoffeeworks.com or call 800-322-6505 for more information.

Review_Description: Rich-toned, deeply sweet. Salted caramel, pomegranate, almond butter, narcissus, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweetly savory structure with citrusy acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. Crisp, focused finish centered around notes of salted caramel and almond.

Review_Description: Sweetly-fruit-forward. Just-picked blueberry, honeycomb, cashew butter, marjoram, baking chocolate in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with pert acidity; pillowy, creamy-smooth mouthfeel. The finish is centered around notes of honey and cashew.

Review_Description: Richly and brightly sweet-savory. Raspberry, lemon verbena, cocoa nib, cedar, pink grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Complex, bittersweet structure with juicy acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa nib and pink grapefruit zest.

Review_Description: Sweetly-tart, fruit-toned. Dried raspberry, baking chocolate, clove, lime zest, fresh-cut oak in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Spice-toned finish with undercurrents of berries and crisp chocolate.

Review_Description: Sweet-toned, pleasingly floral. Baking chocolate, honeysuckle, hazelnut, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, sweet, wood-framed finish with undertones of baking chocolate and hazelnut.
Blind_Assessment: Sweet-toned, pleasingly floral. Baking chocolate, honeysuckle, hazelnut, fresh-cut fir, cane sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; full, velvety mouthfeel. Crisp, sweet, wood-framed finish with undertones of baking chocolate and hazelnut.
Notes: This sample consists entirely of peaberries, a kind of bean that results when the coffee fruit develops a single, oval bean rather than the usual pair of flat-sided beans. Perhaps arbitrarily, Tanzania is particularly associated with its peaberry grades. Review_Description: Delicately sweet-tart. Green grape, cocoa powder, bay leaf, fresh-cut fir, brown sugar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; crisp, velvety mouthfeel. Review_Description: Gently fruit-toned, richly wood-framed. Pie cherry, balsa wood, maple syrup, lemon balm, grapefruit zest in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with gentle, round acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Wood-framed finish with tart cherry and grapefruit suggestions.

Notes: Dur Feres, which means "wild horse" in Amharic, is a blend of green coffees from several southern Ethiopian wet mills or washing stations, including Bombe, Qonqona, Shantawene, and Damo, all processed by the natural method (coffee is dried in the whole fruit). Review_Description: High-toned, chocolaty and richly aromatic. Malted chocolate, black cherry, cashew butter, pink grapefruit, toffee in aroma and cup. Review_Description: Balanced, richly sweet-tart. Apricot, cocoa nib, almond, lemon verbena, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with bright, juicy acidity; crisp, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cocoa-toned almond and lemon verbena.

Review_Description: Sweetly tart, chocolaty. Pomegranate, baking chocolate, orange zest, almond, oak in aroma and cup. Tart-leaning structure with brisk acidity; plush, chewy mouthfeel. Crisply chocolaty finish with undertones of pomegranate and almond.

Review_Description: Gently tart, sweetly herbaceous. Orange zest, pomegranate, cocoa nib, goat milk yogurt, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with tangy acidity; full, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. The gently drying finish centers around notes of orange zest and cedar.

Review_Description: Brightly sweet, quite vibrant. Pink grapefruit, cocoa nib, apricot, bay leaf, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy acidity; very silky, lively mouthfeel. The finish centers around notes of cocoa nib and sweet grapefruit.

Review_Description: Deeply aromatic, fruit-centered. Dried black cherry, cocoa nib, narcissus, thyme, a hint of wine barrel in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet structure with high-toned acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. The finish leads with notes of cocoa nib and narcissus.

Review_Description: Bright, balanced, juicy-sweet. Red plum, cocoa nib, blood orange, star jasmine, lemon verbena in aroma and cup. Richly sweet structure with vibrant acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The finish is long, lingering and flavor-saturated.

Coffee_Name: Colombia Finca Luisa Juan Pablo Carbonic Maceration
Review_Description: Fruit-toned, crisply cocoa-driven. Tropical fruit melange, cocoa powder, gardenia, balsa wood, cashew in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; lightly satiny mouthfeel. Sweet, wood-framed finish with quiet fruit notes.

Notes: Produced by Juan Pablo of Finca La Luisa, from trees of the Yellow and Red Caturra varieties of Arabica, and processed by the natural carbonic maceration method, which involves fermenting whole coffee fruit inside a sealed container that has been flushed with CO2, then drying the coffee in the whole fruit. Review_Description: Crisp, citrusy-sweet. Baking chocolate, lime zest, cedar, date, agave syrup in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with brisk acidity; silky mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of baking chocolate and lime zest.

Following the second fermentation, the coffee is dried mechanically for 72 hours. Review_Description: Complex, deeply engaging. Bing cherry, pomelo, salted caramel, lemon balm, cedar in aroma and cup. Brightly sweet-tart with vivacious acidity; plush, syrupy mouthfeel. The resonant finish consolidates around notes of cherry and bittersweet citrus.

Coffee_Name: Finca El Guarumal El Salvador Black Honey
Review_Description: Fruit-toned, gently fermenty. Dried apricot, wine barrel, dark chocolate, brown sugar, gardenia in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with winy acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with notes of sweet wine-like ferment.
Blind_Assessment: Fruit-toned, gently fermenty. Dried apricot, wine barrel, dark chocolate, brown sugar, gardenia in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with winy acidity; crisp, syrupy mouthfeel. Chocolaty finish with notes of sweet wine-like ferment.
Notes: Produced by Fernando Alfaro and Jose Enrique Gutierrez at Finca El Guarumal from trees of the Yellow Caturra and Red Caturra varieties of Arabica and processed by the black honey method, in which the skins are removed from the fruit but virtually all of the fruit flesh is allowed to dry slowly on the beans, often resulting in a deep, pungent profile. Review_Description: Floral-toned, richly sweet, balanced. Narcissus, dark chocolate, red plum, almond brittle, cedar in aroma and cup. Sweet-tart structure with brisk acidity; very full, syrupy mouthfeel. The crisply sweet finish leads with notes of plum and chocolate with cedar undertones.

Notes: Produced at Granja Paraiso entirely of the Colombia variety of Arabica, and processed by the traditional washed method with Saccromyces Pastorianus yeast added during the ferment step. Review_Description: Crisply sweet, fruit-toned. Dried blueberry, baking chocolate, lily, fresh-cut fir, maple syrup in aroma and cup. Sweet structure with brisk acidity; smooth, satiny mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of dried blueberry and fresh-cut fir with baking chocolate undertones.

Review_Description: Elegantly fruit-toned, crisp and bright. Strawberry guava, cocoa nib, lilac, pistachio, lemon thyme in aroma and cup. Richly sweet-tart structure with juicy acidity; viscous, satiny mouthfeel. Berry-toned finish supported by cocoa nib.
Origin: Ka'u growing region, Big Island of Hawai’i

Coffee_Name: Ethiopia Gesha Village Illubabor Forest Lot 22/043 (Single-Terroir) Natural Process
Review_Description: Elegantly sweet, fruit- and floral toned. Dried Bing cherry, star jasmine, cocoa nib, sandalwood, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, bright acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Resounding and very long finish centered around notes of Bing cherry, cocoa nib, and star jasmine.
Blind_Assessment: Elegantly sweet, fruit- and floral toned. Dried Bing cherry, star jasmine, cocoa nib, sandalwood, marjoram in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with juicy, bright acidity; crisp, silky mouthfeel. Resounding and very long finish centered around notes of Bing cherry, cocoa nib, and star jasmine.
Notes: Produced from trees of the rare Ethiopia-derived botanical variety Gesha (also Geisha) by Adam and Rachel Overton. With its generally elongated beans and distinctive floral and crisp, often chocolaty cup, the Gesha variety continues to distinguish itself as one of the world’s most unique coffees. Although the Gesha variety originated in Ethiopia, it was “discovered” by the coffee world in 2004 growing in Boquete, Panama, and Panama continues to dominate the expanding world of Gesha. This particular version, however, is the outcome of efforts to commercialize Gesha in the region from which it originally came. It was processed by the natural method (dried in the whole fruit). Buon Caffe is a specialty coffee roaster and cafe in Taipei, Taiwan. Visit www.buoncaffe.com.tw for more information.
Bottom_Line: A sophisticated, nuanced natural-processed Ethiopia Gesha centered around notes of dried stonefruit, cocoa nib and sweet herbs.

Review_Description: Delicately aromatic, complex. Lilac, cocoa nib, pink grapefruit zest, shishito pepper, apricot in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart with juicy, bright acidity; plush, syrupy-smooth mouthfeel. Floral finish with cocoa undertones.

Review_Description: Elegantly bright, very balanced. Apricot, honeysuckle, almond brittle, dark chocolate, cedar in aroma and cup. Richly sweet structure with floral acidity; lively, silky mouthfeel. Long, lingering, complexly satiating finish.

Review_Description: High-toned, fruit-driven. Raspberry jam, cocoa nib, Meyer lemon zest, narcissus, a hint of oregano in aroma and cup. Sweetly tart structure with bright, juicy acidity; round, plush mouthfeel. The confident finish centers around notes of raspberry and cocoa nib.

Review_Description: Crisply sweet-savory, rich-toned. Cocoa nib, grape candy, hop flowers, amber, sandalwood in aroma and cup. Savory-leaning structure with sparkling acidity; viscous, very full mouthfeel. A crisply sweet-savory finish consolidates to notes of amber and cocoa nib.

Review_Description: Sweetly nutty, crisply chocolaty. Cashew butter, baking chocolate, date, maple syrup, magnolia in aroma and cup. Sweet-toned structure with brisk acidity; full, creamy mouthfeel. The finish consolidates to notes of cashew and maple syrup.

Review_Description: Elegantly fruit-forward, delicately juicy. Strawberry guava, malted milk balls, freesia-like flowers, pink peppercorn, marjoram in aroma and cup. Balanced, sweet-tart structure with gently bright acidity; plump, satiny mouthfeel. Crisp, sweet finish centered on suggestions of freesia and pink peppercorn.
